class  BlockList
 A class that is designed to mimic std::list, but with better destructor speed It achieves this by allocating comparatively large chunks of memory as it needs This is not thread safe, except, when there is guarantee of at most one writer AND the TBB data structure is in use. More...

Definition at line 31 of file BinaryConstraintOps.h.

31  {
32  __UNDEFINED__, // undefined operator
33  EQ, // equivalence of two values
34  NE, // whether two values are different
35  LT, // less-than
36  LE, // less-than-or-equal-to
37  GT, // greater-than
38  GE, // greater-than-or-equal-to
39  MATCH, // matching string
40  CONTAINS, // whether a sub-string is contained in a string
41  NOT_MATCH, // not matching string
42  NOT_CONTAINS // whether a sub-string is not contained in a string
43 };

405  {

407  std::set<std::string> specifiedRelations = split(Global::config().get("magic-transform"), ',');

411  return relations;
412  }
413

415  std::set<AstRelationIdentifier> targetRelations;

417  std::string mainName = rel->getName().getNames()[0];
418  if (contains(specifiedRelations, mainName)) {
419  targetRelations.insert(rel->getName());
420  }
421  }
422

bool souffle::areBijectivelyEquivalent ( const AstClause *  left,
const AstClause *  right 
)

Check whether two clauses are bijectively equivalent.

Definition at line 246 of file MinimiseProgramTransformer.cpp.

References extractPermutations(), souffle::AstClause::getBodyLiterals(), i, isValidMove(), isValidPermutation(), j, and visitDepthFirst().

Referenced by souffle::MinimiseProgramTransformer::transform().

246  {
247  // only check bijective equivalence for a subset of the possible clauses
248  auto isValidClause = [&](const AstClause* clause) {
249  // check that all body literals are atoms
250  // i.e. avoid clauses with constraints or negations
251  for (AstLiteral* lit : clause->getBodyLiterals()) {
252  if (dynamic_cast<AstAtom*>(lit) == nullptr) {
253  return false;
254  }
255  }
256 
257  // check that all arguments are either constants or variables
258  // i.e. only allow primitive arguments
259  bool valid = true;
260  visitDepthFirst(*clause, [&](const AstArgument& arg) {
261  if (dynamic_cast<const AstVariable*>(&arg) == nullptr &&
262  dynamic_cast<const AstConstant*>(&arg) == nullptr) {
263  valid = false;
264  }
265  });
266  return valid;
267  };
268 
269  if (!isValidClause(left) || !isValidClause(right)) {
270  return false;
271  }
272 
273  // rules must be the same length to be equal
274  if (left->getBodyLiterals().size() != right->getBodyLiterals().size()) {
275  return false;
276  }
277 
278  // set up the n x n permutation matrix, where n is the number of
279  // atoms in the clause, including the head atom
280  size_t size = left->getBodyLiterals().size() + 1;
281  auto permutationMatrix = std::vector<std::vector<unsigned int>>(size);
282  for (size_t i = 0; i < permutationMatrix.size(); i++) {
283  permutationMatrix[i] = std::vector<unsigned int>(size);
284  }
285 
286  // create permutation matrix
287  for (size_t i = 0; i < size; i++) {
288  for (size_t j = 0; j < size; j++) {
289  if (isValidMove(left, i, right, j)) {
290  permutationMatrix[i][j] = 1;
291  }
292  }
293  }
294 
295  // check if any of these permutations have valid variable mappings associated with them
296  std::vector<std::vector<unsigned int>> permutations = extractPermutations(permutationMatrix);
297  for (auto permutation : permutations) {
298  if (isValidPermutation(left, right, permutation)) {
299  // valid permutation with valid corresponding variable mapping exists
300  // therefore, the two clauses are equivalent!
301  return true;
302  }
303  }
304 
305  return false;
306 }
j
var j

BindingStore souffle::bindComposites ( const AstProgram *  program)

Definition at line 628 of file MagicSet.cpp.

References souffle::BindingStore::addBinding(), constraints, EQ, souffle::AstProgram::getRelations(), and rel().

Referenced by souffle::Adornment::run().

628  {
629  struct M : public AstNodeMapper {
630  BindingStore& compositeBindings;
631  std::set<AstBinaryConstraint*>& constraints;
632  mutable int changeCount;
633 
634  M(BindingStore& compositeBindings, std::set<AstBinaryConstraint*>& constraints, int changeCount)
635  : compositeBindings(compositeBindings), constraints(constraints), changeCount(changeCount) {}
636 
637  int getChangeCount() const {
638  return changeCount;
639  }
640 
641  std::unique_ptr<AstNode> operator()(std::unique_ptr<AstNode> node) const override {
642  if (auto* functor = dynamic_cast<AstFunctor*>(node.get())) {
643  // functor found
644  changeCount++;
645 
646  // create new variable name (with appropriate suffix)
647  std::stringstream newVariableName;
648  newVariableName << "+functor" << changeCount;
649 
650  // add the binding to the BindingStore
651  compositeBindings.addBinding(newVariableName.str(), functor);
652 
653  // create new constraint (+functorX = original-functor)
654  auto newVariable = std::make_unique<AstVariable>(newVariableName.str());
655  constraints.insert(new AstBinaryConstraint(BinaryConstraintOp::EQ,
656  std::unique_ptr<AstArgument>(newVariable->clone()),
657  std::unique_ptr<AstArgument>(functor->clone())));
658 
659  // update functor to be the variable created
660  return std::move(newVariable);
661  } else if (auto* record = dynamic_cast<AstRecordInit*>(node.get())) {
662  // record found
663  changeCount++;
664 
665  // create new variable name (with appropriate suffix)
666  std::stringstream newVariableName;
667  newVariableName << "+record" << changeCount;
668 
669  // add the binding to the BindingStore
670  compositeBindings.addBinding(newVariableName.str(), record);
671 
672  // create new constraint (+recordX = original-record)
673  auto newVariable = std::make_unique<AstVariable>(newVariableName.str());
674  constraints.insert(new AstBinaryConstraint(BinaryConstraintOp::EQ,
675  std::unique_ptr<AstArgument>(newVariable->clone()),
676  std::unique_ptr<AstArgument>(record->clone())));
677 
678  // update record to be the variable created
679  return std::move(newVariable);
680  }
681  node->apply(*this);
682  return node;
683  }
684  };
685 
686  BindingStore compositeBindings;
687 
688  int changeCount = 0; // number of functors/records seen so far
689 
690  // apply the change to all clauses in the program
691  for (AstRelation* rel : program->getRelations()) {
692  for (AstClause* clause : rel->getClauses()) {
693  std::set<AstBinaryConstraint*> constraints;
694  M update(compositeBindings, constraints, changeCount);
695  clause->apply(update);
696 
697  changeCount = update.getChangeCount();
698 
699  for (AstBinaryConstraint* constraint : constraints) {
700  clause->addToBody(std::unique_ptr<AstBinaryConstraint>(constraint));
701  }
702  }
703  }
704 
705  return compositeBindings;
706 }
rel

std::vector<std::vector<AstLiteral*> > souffle::combineNegatedLiterals ( std::vector< std::vector< AstLiteral * >>  litGroups)

Return the negated version of a disjunction of conjunctions.

E.g. (a1(x) ^ a2(x) ^ ...) v (b1(x) ^ b2(x) ^ ...) –into-> (!a1(x) ^ !b1(x)) v (!a2(x) ^ !b2(x)) v ...

Definition at line 357 of file InlineRelationsTransformer.cpp.

References i, and negateLiteral().

Referenced by formNegatedLiterals().

358  {
359  std::vector<std::vector<AstLiteral*>> negation;
360 
361  // Corner case: !() = ()
362  if (litGroups.empty()) {
363  return negation;
364  }
365 
366  std::vector<AstLiteral*> litGroup = litGroups[0];
367  if (litGroups.size() == 1) {
368  // !(a1 ^ a2 ^ a3 ^ ...) --into-> !a1 v !a2 v !a3 v ...
369  for (auto& i : litGroup) {
370  std::vector<AstLiteral*> newVec;
371  newVec.push_back(negateLiteral(i));
372  negation.push_back(newVec);
373  }
374 
375  // Done!
376  return negation;
377  }
378 
379  // Produce the negated versions of all disjunctions ignoring the first recursively
380  std::vector<std::vector<AstLiteral*>> combinedRHS = combineNegatedLiterals(
381  std::vector<std::vector<AstLiteral*>>(litGroups.begin() + 1, litGroups.end()));
382 
383  // We now just need to add the negation of a single literal from the untouched LHS
384  // to every single conjunction on the RHS to finalise creating every possible combination
385  for (AstLiteral* lhsLit : litGroup) {
386  for (std::vector<AstLiteral*> rhsVec : combinedRHS) {
387  std::vector<AstLiteral*> newVec;
388  newVec.push_back(negateLiteral(lhsLit));
389 
390  for (AstLiteral* lit : rhsVec) {
391  newVec.push_back(lit);
392  }
393 
394  negation.push_back(newVec);
395  }
396  }
397 
398  return negation;
399 }
souffle::combineNegatedLiterals

Return the negated version of a disjunction of conjunctions.

AstClause* souffle::createAnnotatedClause ( const AstClause *  clause,
const std::map< const AstArgument *, TypeSet >  argumentTypes 
)

Definition at line 790 of file AstTypeAnalysis.cpp.

References souffle::AstClause::apply(), souffle::AstClause::clone(), i, types, and visitDepthFirst().

Referenced by souffle::TypeAnalysis::run().

791  {
792  // Annotates each variable with its type based on a given type analysis result
793  struct TypeAnnotator : public AstNodeMapper {
794  const std::map<const AstArgument*, TypeSet>& types;
795 
796  TypeAnnotator(const std::map<const AstArgument*, TypeSet>& types) : types(types) {}
797 
798  std::unique_ptr<AstNode> operator()(std::unique_ptr<AstNode> node) const override {
799  if (auto* var = dynamic_cast<AstVariable*>(node.get())) {
800  std::stringstream newVarName;
801  newVarName << var->getName() << "&isin;" << types.find(var)->second;
802  return std::make_unique<AstVariable>(newVarName.str());
803  } else if (auto* var = dynamic_cast<AstUnnamedVariable*>(node.get())) {
804  std::stringstream newVarName;
805  newVarName << "_"
806  << "&isin;" << types.find(var)->second;
807  return std::make_unique<AstVariable>(newVarName.str());
808  }
809  node->apply(*this);
810  return node;
811  }
812  };
813 
814  /* Note:
815  * Because the type of each argument is stored in the form [address -> type-set],
816  * the type-analysis result does not immediately apply to the clone due to differing
817  * addresses.
818  * Two ways around this:
819  * (1) Perform the type-analysis again for the cloned clause
820  * (2) Keep track of the addresses of equivalent arguments in the cloned clause
821  * Method (2) was chosen to avoid having to recompute the analysis each time.
822  */
823  AstClause* annotatedClause = clause->clone();
824 
825  // Maps x -> y, where x is the address of an argument in the original clause, and y
826  // is the address of the equivalent argument in the clone.
827  std::map<const AstArgument*, const AstArgument*> memoryMap;
828 
829  std::vector<const AstArgument*> originalAddresses;
830  visitDepthFirst(*clause, [&](const AstArgument& arg) { originalAddresses.push_back(&arg); });
831 
832  std::vector<const AstArgument*> cloneAddresses;
833  visitDepthFirst(*annotatedClause, [&](const AstArgument& arg) { cloneAddresses.push_back(&arg); });
834 
835  assert(cloneAddresses.size() == originalAddresses.size());
836 
837  for (size_t i = 0; i < originalAddresses.size(); i++) {
838  memoryMap[originalAddresses[i]] = cloneAddresses[i];
839  }
840 
841  // Map the types to the clause clone
842  std::map<const AstArgument*, TypeSet> cloneArgumentTypes;
843  for (auto& pair : argumentTypes) {
844  cloneArgumentTypes[memoryMap[pair.first]] = pair.second;
845  }
846 
847  // Create the type-annotated clause
848  TypeAnnotator annotator(cloneArgumentTypes);
849  annotatedClause->apply(annotator);
850  return annotatedClause;
851 }
i
size_t i

std::string souffle::dirName ( const std::string &  name)

std::vector<std::vector<unsigned int> > souffle::extractPermutations ( const std::vector< std::vector< unsigned int >> &  permutationMatrix)

Extract valid permutations from a given permutation matrix of valid moves.

Definition at line 27 of file MinimiseProgramTransformer.cpp.

References i, j, and seen.

Referenced by areBijectivelyEquivalent().

28  {
29  size_t clauseSize = permutationMatrix.size();
30  // keep track of the possible end-positions of each atom in the first clause
31  std::vector<std::vector<unsigned int>> validMoves;
32  for (size_t i = 0; i < clauseSize; i++) {
33  std::vector<unsigned int> currentRow;
34  for (size_t j = 0; j < clauseSize; j++) {
35  if (permutationMatrix[i][j] == 1) {
36  currentRow.push_back(j);
37  }
38  }
39  validMoves.push_back(currentRow);
40  }
41 
42  // extract the possible permutations, DFS style
43  std::vector<std::vector<unsigned int>> permutations;
44  std::vector<unsigned int> seen(clauseSize);
45  std::vector<unsigned int> currentPermutation;
46  std::stack<std::vector<unsigned int>> todoStack;
47 
48  todoStack.push(validMoves[0]);
49 
50  size_t currentIdx = 0;
51  while (!todoStack.empty()) {
52  if (currentIdx == clauseSize) {
53  // permutation is complete
54  permutations.push_back(currentPermutation);
55 
56  if (currentIdx == 0) {
57  // already at starting position, so no more permutations possible
58  break;
59  }
60 
61  // undo the last number added to the permutation
62  currentIdx--;
63  seen[currentPermutation[currentIdx]] = 0;
64  currentPermutation.pop_back();
65 
66  // see if we can pick up other permutations
67  continue;
68  }
69 
70  // pull out the possibilities for the current point of the permutation
71  std::vector<unsigned int> possibilities = todoStack.top();
72  todoStack.pop();
73  if (possibilities.empty()) {
74  // no more possibilities at this point, so undo our last move
75 
76  if (currentIdx == 0) {
77  // already at starting position, so no more permutations possible
78  break;
79  }
80 
81  currentIdx--;
82  seen[currentPermutation[currentIdx]] = 0;
83  currentPermutation.pop_back();
84 
85  // continue looking for permutations
86  continue;
87  }
88 
89  // try the next possibility
90  unsigned int nextNum = possibilities[0];
91 
92  // update the possibility vector for the current position
93  possibilities.erase(possibilities.begin());
94  todoStack.push(possibilities);
95 
96  if (seen[nextNum]) {
97  // number already seen in this permutation
98  continue;
99  } else {
100  // number can be used
101  seen[nextNum] = 1;
102  currentPermutation.push_back(nextNum);
103  currentIdx++;
104 
105  // if we havent reached the end of the permutation,
106  // push up the valid moves for the next position
107  if (currentIdx < clauseSize) {
108  todoStack.push(validMoves[currentIdx]);
109  }
110  }
111  }
112 
113  // found all permutations
114  return permutations;
115 }

1131  const size_t lastDot = name.find_last_of('.');
1132  // file has no extension
1133  if (lastDot == std::string::npos) return std::string();

std::vector<AstRelationIdentifier> souffle::findInlineCycle ( const PrecedenceGraph &  precedenceGraph,
std::map< const AstRelation *, const AstRelation * > &  origins,
const AstRelation *  current,
AstRelationSet &  unvisited,
AstRelationSet &  visiting,
AstRelationSet &  visited 
)

Find a cycle consisting entirely of inlined relations.

If no cycle exists, then an empty vector is returned.

Definition at line 883 of file AstSemanticChecker.cpp.

References souffle::AstRelation::getName(), and souffle::PrecedenceGraph::graph().

Referenced by souffle::AstSemanticChecker::checkInlining().

885  {
886  std::vector<AstRelationIdentifier> result;
887 
888  if (current == nullptr) {
889  // Not looking at any nodes at the moment, so choose any node from the unvisited list
890 
891  if (unvisited.empty()) {
892  // Nothing left to visit - so no cycles exist!
893  return result;
894  }
895 
896  // Choose any element from the unvisited set
897  current = *unvisited.begin();
898  origins[current] = nullptr;
899 
900  // Move it to "currently visiting"
901  unvisited.erase(current);
902  visiting.insert(current);
903 
904  // Check if we can find a cycle beginning from this node
905  std::vector<AstRelationIdentifier> subresult =
906  findInlineCycle(precedenceGraph, origins, current, unvisited, visiting, visited);
907 
908  if (subresult.empty()) {
909  // No cycle found, try again from another node
910  return findInlineCycle(precedenceGraph, origins, nullptr, unvisited, visiting, visited);
911  } else {
912  // Cycle found! Return it
913  return subresult;
914  }
915  }
916 
917  // Check neighbours
918  const AstRelationSet& successors = precedenceGraph.graph().successors(current);
919  for (const AstRelation* successor : successors) {
920  // Only care about inlined neighbours in the graph
921  if (successor->isInline()) {
922  if (visited.find(successor) != visited.end()) {
923  // The neighbour has already been visited, so move on
924  continue;
925  }
926 
927  if (visiting.find(successor) != visiting.end()) {
928  // Found a cycle!!
929  // Construct the cycle in reverse
930  while (current != nullptr) {
931  result.push_back(current->getName());
932  current = origins[current];
933  }
934  return result;
935  }
936 
937  // Node has not been visited yet
938  origins[successor] = current;
939 
940  // Move from unvisited to visiting
941  unvisited.erase(successor);
942  visiting.insert(successor);
943 
944  // Visit recursively and check if a cycle is formed
945  std::vector<AstRelationIdentifier> subgraphCycle =
946  findInlineCycle(precedenceGraph, origins, successor, unvisited, visiting, visited);
947 
948  if (!subgraphCycle.empty()) {
949  // Found a cycle!
950  return subgraphCycle;
951  }
952  }
953  }
954 
955  // Visited all neighbours with no cycle found, so done visiting this node.
956  visiting.erase(current);
957  visited.insert(current);
958  return result;
959 }

Definition: Util.h:1055
std::vector<std::vector<AstLiteral*> > souffle::formNegatedLiterals ( AstProgram &  program,
AstAtom *  atom 
)

Forms the bodies that will replace the negation of a given inlined atom.

E.g. a(x) <- (a11(x), a12(x)) ; (a21(x), a22(x)) => !a(x) <- (!a11(x), !a21(x)) ; (!a11(x), !a22(x)) ; ... Essentially, produce every combination (m_1 ^ m_2 ^ ...) where m_i is the negation of a literal in the ith rule of a.

Definition at line 407 of file InlineRelationsTransformer.cpp.

References combineNegatedLiterals(), souffle::AstAtom::getName(), souffle::AstProgram::getRelation(), souffle::NullableVector< T >::getVector(), inlineBodyLiterals(), and souffle::NullableVector< T >::isValid().

Referenced by getInlinedLiteral().

407  {
408  // Constraints added to unify atoms should not be negated and should be added to
409  // all the final rule combinations produced, and so should be stored separately.
410  std::vector<std::vector<AstLiteral*>> addedBodyLiterals;
411  std::vector<std::vector<AstBinaryConstraint*>> addedConstraints;
412 
413  // Go through every possible clause associated with the given atom
414  for (AstClause* inClause : program.getRelation(atom->getName())->getClauses()) {
415  // Form the replacement clause by inlining based on the current clause
416  std::pair<NullableVector<AstLiteral*>, std::vector<AstBinaryConstraint*>> inlineResult =
417  inlineBodyLiterals(atom, inClause);
418  NullableVector<AstLiteral*> replacementBodyLiterals = inlineResult.first;
419  std::vector<AstBinaryConstraint*> currConstraints = inlineResult.second;
420 
421  if (!replacementBodyLiterals.isValid()) {
422  // Failed to unify, so just move on
423  continue;
424  }
425 
426  addedBodyLiterals.push_back(replacementBodyLiterals.getVector());
427  addedConstraints.push_back(currConstraints);
428  }
429 
430  // We now have a list of bodies needed to inline the given atom.
431  // We want to inline the negated version, however, which is done using De Morgan's Law.
432  std::vector<std::vector<AstLiteral*>> negatedAddedBodyLiterals =
433  combineNegatedLiterals(addedBodyLiterals);
434 
435  // Add in the necessary constraints to all the body literals
436  for (auto& negatedAddedBodyLiteral : negatedAddedBodyLiterals) {
437  for (std::vector<AstBinaryConstraint*> constraintGroup : addedConstraints) {
438  for (AstBinaryConstraint* constraint : constraintGroup) {
439  negatedAddedBodyLiteral.push_back(constraint->clone());
440  }
441  }
442  }
443 
444  // Free up the old body literals and constraints
445  for (std::vector<AstLiteral*> litGroup : addedBodyLiterals) {
446  for (AstLiteral* lit : litGroup) {
447  delete lit;
448  }
449  }
450  for (std::vector<AstBinaryConstraint*> consGroup : addedConstraints) {
451  for (AstConstraint* cons : consGroup) {
452  delete cons;
453  }
454  }
455 
456  return negatedAddedBodyLiterals;
457 }

Inlines the given atom based on a given clause.

102  if (symbol == "cat") return BinaryOp::CAT;
103  std::cout << "Unrecognised operator: " << symbol << "\n";
104  assert(false && "Unsupported Operator!");

Analyse the given clause and computes for each contained argument whether it is a constant value or not.

Parameters

Returns
a map mapping each contained argument to a boolean indicating whether the argument represents a constant value or not

Definition at line 264 of file AstTypeAnalysis.cpp.

References EQ, souffle::AstTernaryFunctor::getArg(), souffle::AstRecordInit::getArguments(), souffle::AstBinaryFunctor::getLHS(), souffle::AstBinaryConstraint::getLHS(), souffle::AstUnaryFunctor::getOperand(), souffle::AstBinaryConstraint::getOperator(), souffle::AstBinaryFunctor::getRHS(), souffle::AstBinaryConstraint::getRHS(), lhs, pack(), and rhs.

264  {
265  // define analysis ..
266  struct Analysis : public AstConstraintAnalysis<BoolDisjunctVar> {
267  // #1 - constants are constant
268  void visitConstant(const AstConstant& cur) override {
269  // this is a constant value
270  addConstraint(isTrue(getVar(cur)));
271  }
272 
273  // #2 - binary relations may propagate const
274  void visitBinaryConstraint(const AstBinaryConstraint& cur) override {
275  // only target equality
276  if (cur.getOperator() != BinaryConstraintOp::EQ) {
277  return;
278  }
279 
280  // if equal, link right and left side
281  auto lhs = getVar(cur.getLHS());
282  auto rhs = getVar(cur.getRHS());
283 
284  addConstraint(imply(lhs, rhs));
285  addConstraint(imply(rhs, lhs));
286  }
287 
288  // #3 - const is propagated via unary functors
289  void visitUnaryFunctor(const AstUnaryFunctor& cur) override {
290  auto fun = getVar(cur);
291  auto op = getVar(cur.getOperand());
292 
293  addConstraint(imply(op, fun));
294  }
295 
296  // #4 - const is propagated via binary functors
297  void visitBinaryFunctor(const AstBinaryFunctor& cur) override {
298  auto fun = getVar(cur);
299  auto lhs = getVar(cur.getLHS());
300  auto rhs = getVar(cur.getRHS());
301 
302  addConstraint(imply({lhs, rhs}, fun));
303  addConstraint(imply({fun, lhs}, rhs));
304  addConstraint(imply({fun, rhs}, lhs));
305  }
306 
307  // #5 - const is propagated via ternary functors
308  void visitTernaryFunctor(const AstTernaryFunctor& cur) override {
309  auto fun = getVar(cur);
310  auto a0 = getVar(cur.getArg(0));
311  auto a1 = getVar(cur.getArg(1));
312  auto a2 = getVar(cur.getArg(2));
313 
314  addConstraint(imply({a0, a1, a2}, fun));
315  }
316 
317  // #6 - if pack nodes and its components
318  void visitRecordInit(const AstRecordInit& init) override {
319  auto pack = getVar(init);
320 
321  std::vector<BoolDisjunctVar> subs;
322  for (const auto& cur : init.getArguments()) {
323  subs.push_back(getVar(cur));
324  }
325 
326  // link vars in both directions
327  addConstraint(imply(subs, pack));
328  for (const auto& c : subs) {
329  addConstraint(imply(pack, c));
330  }
331  }
332  };
333 
334  // run analysis on given clause
335  return Analysis().analyse(clause);
336 }

TypeSet souffle::getGreatestCommonSubtypes ( const Type &  a,
const Type &  b 
)

Computes the greatest common sub types of the two given types.

Definition at line 503 of file TypeSystem.cpp.

Referenced by getGreatestCommonSubtypes().

503  {
504  // make sure they are in the same type environment
505  assert(a.getTypeEnvironment().isType(a) && a.getTypeEnvironment().isType(b));
506 
507  // if they are equal it is easy
508  if (a == b) {
509  return TypeSet(a);
510  }
511 
512  // equally simple - check whether one is a sub-type of the other
513  if (isSubtypeOf(a, b)) {
514  return TypeSet(a);
515  }
516  if (isSubtypeOf(b, a)) {
517  return TypeSet(b);
518  }
519 
520  // last option: if both are unions with common sub-types
521  TypeSet res;
522  if (isUnion(a) && isUnion(b)) {
523  // collect common sub-types of union types
524 
525  struct collector : public TypeVisitor<void> {
526  const Type& b;
527  TypeSet& res;
528  collector(const Type& b, TypeSet& res) : b(b), res(res) {}
529  void visit(const Type& type) const override {
530  if (isSubtypeOf(type, b)) {
531  res.insert(type);
532  } else {
533  TypeVisitor<void>::visit(type);
534  }
535  }
536  void visitUnionType(const UnionType& type) const override {
537  for (const auto& cur : type.getElementTypes()) {
538  visit(*cur);
539  }
540  }
541  };
542 
543  // collect all common sub-types
544  collector(b, res).visit(a);
545  }
546 
547  // otherwise there is no common super type
548  return res;
549 }

TypeSet souffle::getGreatestCommonSubtypes ( const TypeSet &  set)

Computes the greatest common sub types of all the types in the given set.

Definition at line 551 of file TypeSystem.cpp.

References souffle::TypeSet::begin(), souffle::TypeSet::empty(), souffle::TypeSet::end(), getGreatestCommonSubtypes(), souffle::TypeSet::insert(), and souffle::TypeSet::isAll().

551  {
552  // handle the empty set
553  if (set.empty()) {
554  return set;
555  }
556 
557  // handle the all set => empty set (since no common sub-type)
558  if (set.isAll()) {
559  return TypeSet();
560  }
561 
562  TypeSet res;
563  auto it = set.begin();
564  res.insert(*it);
565  ++it;
566 
567  // refine sub-set step by step
568  for (; it != set.end(); ++it) {
569  TypeSet tmp;
570  for (const Type& cur : res) {
571  tmp.insert(getGreatestCommonSubtypes(cur, *it));
572  }
573  res = tmp;
574  }
575 
576  // done
577  return res;
578 }

)

The set of pair-wise greatest common sub types of the types in the two given sets.

580  {
581  // special cases
582  if (a.empty()) {
583  return a;
584  }
585  if (b.empty()) {
586  return b;
587  }
588

590  return b;

593  return a;
594  }
595

std::map< const AstArgument *, bool > souffle::getGroundedTerms ( const AstClause &  clause)

Analyse the given clause and computes for each contained argument whether it is a grounded value or not.

Parameters
clausethe clause to be analyzed
Returns
a map mapping each contained argument to a boolean indicating whether the argument represents a grounded value or not

Definition at line 338 of file AstTypeAnalysis.cpp.

References EQ, souffle::AstTernaryFunctor::getArg(), souffle::AstAtom::getArguments(), souffle::AstRecordInit::getArguments(), souffle::AstNegation::getAtom(), souffle::AstClause::getHead(), souffle::AstBinaryFunctor::getLHS(), souffle::AstBinaryConstraint::getLHS(), souffle::AstUnaryFunctor::getOperand(), souffle::AstBinaryConstraint::getOperator(), souffle::AstBinaryFunctor::getRHS(), souffle::AstBinaryConstraint::getRHS(), lhs, and rhs.

Referenced by souffle::AstSemanticChecker::checkProgram(), and usesInvalidWitness().

338  {
339  // define analysis ..
340  struct Analysis : public AstConstraintAnalysis<BoolDisjunctVar> {
341  std::set<const AstAtom*> ignore;
342 
343  // #1 - atoms are producing grounded variables
344  void visitAtom(const AstAtom& cur) override {
345  // some atoms need to be skipped (head or negation)
346  if (ignore.find(&cur) != ignore.end()) {
347  return;
348  }
349 
350  // all arguments are grounded
351  for (const auto& arg : cur.getArguments()) {
352  addConstraint(isTrue(getVar(arg)));
353  }
354  }
355 
356  // #2 - negations need to be skipped
357  void visitNegation(const AstNegation& cur) override {
358  // add nested atom to black-list
359  ignore.insert(cur.getAtom());
360  }
361 
362  // #3 - also skip head
363  void visitClause(const AstClause& clause) override {
364  // ignore head
365  ignore.insert(clause.getHead());
366  }
367 
368  // #4 - binary equality relations propagates groundness
369  void visitBinaryConstraint(const AstBinaryConstraint& cur) override {
370  // only target equality
371  if (cur.getOperator() != BinaryConstraintOp::EQ) {
372  return;
373  }
374 
375  // if equal, link right and left side
376  auto lhs = getVar(cur.getLHS());
377  auto rhs = getVar(cur.getRHS());
378 
379  addConstraint(imply(lhs, rhs));
380  addConstraint(imply(rhs, lhs));
381  }
382 
383  // #5 - record init nodes
384  void visitRecordInit(const AstRecordInit& init) override {
385  auto cur = getVar(init);
386 
387  std::vector<BoolDisjunctVar> vars;
388 
389  // if record is grounded, so are all its arguments
390  for (const auto& arg : init.getArguments()) {
391  auto arg_var = getVar(arg);
392  addConstraint(imply(cur, arg_var));
393  vars.push_back(arg_var);
394  }
395 
396  // if all arguments are grounded, so is the record
397  addConstraint(imply(vars, cur));
398  }
399 
400  // #6 - constants are also sources of grounded values
401  void visitConstant(const AstConstant& c) override {
402  addConstraint(isTrue(getVar(c)));
403  }
404 
405  // #7 - aggregators are grounding values
406  void visitAggregator(const AstAggregator& c) override {
407  addConstraint(isTrue(getVar(c)));
408  }
409 
410  // #8 - functors with grounded values are grounded values
411  void visitUnaryFunctor(const AstUnaryFunctor& cur) override {
412  auto fun = getVar(cur);
413  auto arg = getVar(cur.getOperand());
414 
415  addConstraint(imply(arg, fun));
416  }
417 
418  void visitBinaryFunctor(const AstBinaryFunctor& cur) override {
419  auto fun = getVar(cur);
420  auto lhs = getVar(cur.getLHS());
421  auto rhs = getVar(cur.getRHS());
422 
423  addConstraint(imply({lhs, rhs}, fun));
424  }
425 
426  void visitTernaryFunctor(const AstTernaryFunctor& cur) override {
427  auto fun = getVar(cur);
428  auto a0 = getVar(cur.getArg(0));
429  auto a1 = getVar(cur.getArg(1));
430  auto a2 = getVar(cur.getArg(2));
431 
432  addConstraint(imply({a0, a1, a2}, fun));
433  }
434  };
435 
436  // run analysis on given clause
437  return Analysis().analyse(clause);
438 }
lhs

The two terms to be equivalent.

Here is the call graph for this function:

NullableVector<AstArgument*> souffle::getInlinedArgument ( AstProgram &  program,
const AstArgument *  arg 
)

Returns a vector of arguments that should replace the given argument after one step of inlining.

Note: This function is currently generalised to perform any required inlining within aggregators as well, making it simple to extend to this later on if desired (and the semantic check is removed).

Definition at line 510 of file InlineRelationsTransformer.cpp.

References ADD, combineAggregators(), souffle::AstAggregator::count, getInlinedLiteral(), souffle::NullableVector< T >::getVector(), i, souffle::NullableVector< T >::isValid(), j, MAX, souffle::AstAggregator::max, MIN, souffle::AstAggregator::min, souffle::AstAggregator::setTargetExpression(), and souffle::AstAggregator::sum.

Referenced by getInlinedAtom(), and getInlinedLiteral().

510  {
511  bool changed = false;
512  std::vector<AstArgument*> versions;
513 
514  // Each argument has to be handled differently - essentially, want to go down to
515  // nested aggregators, and inline their bodies if needed.
516  if (const auto* aggr = dynamic_cast<const AstAggregator*>(arg)) {
517  // First try inlining the target expression if necessary
518  if (aggr->getTargetExpression() != nullptr) {
519  NullableVector<AstArgument*> argumentVersions =
520  getInlinedArgument(program, aggr->getTargetExpression());
521 
522  if (argumentVersions.isValid()) {
523  // An element in the target expression can be inlined!
524  changed = true;
525 
526  // Create a new aggregator per version of the target expression
527  for (AstArgument* newArg : argumentVersions.getVector()) {
528  auto* newAggr = new AstAggregator(aggr->getOperator());
529  newAggr->setTargetExpression(std::unique_ptr<AstArgument>(newArg));
530  for (AstLiteral* lit : aggr->getBodyLiterals()) {
531  newAggr->addBodyLiteral(std::unique_ptr<AstLiteral>(lit->clone()));
532  }
533  versions.push_back(newAggr);
534  }
535  }
536  }
537 
538  // Try inlining body arguments if the target expression has not been changed.
539  // (At this point we only handle one step of inlining at a time)
540  if (!changed) {
541  std::vector<AstLiteral*> bodyLiterals = aggr->getBodyLiterals();
542  for (size_t i = 0; i < bodyLiterals.size(); i++) {
543  AstLiteral* currLit = bodyLiterals[i];
544 
545  NullableVector<std::vector<AstLiteral*>> literalVersions =
546  getInlinedLiteral(program, currLit);
547 
548  if (literalVersions.isValid()) {
549  // Literal can be inlined!
550  changed = true;
551 
552  AstAggregator::Op op = aggr->getOperator();
553 
554  // Create an aggregator (with the same operation) for each possible body
555  std::vector<AstAggregator*> aggrVersions;
556  for (std::vector<AstLiteral*> inlineVersions : literalVersions.getVector()) {
557  auto* newAggr = new AstAggregator(aggr->getOperator());
558  if (aggr->getTargetExpression() != nullptr) {
559  newAggr->setTargetExpression(
560  std::unique_ptr<AstArgument>(aggr->getTargetExpression()->clone()));
561  }
562 
563  // Add in everything except the current literal being replaced
564  for (size_t j = 0; j < bodyLiterals.size(); j++) {
565  if (i != j) {
566  newAggr->addBodyLiteral(
567  std::unique_ptr<AstLiteral>(bodyLiterals[j]->clone()));
568  }
569  }
570 
571  // Add in everything new that replaces that literal
572  for (AstLiteral* addedLit : inlineVersions) {
573  newAggr->addBodyLiteral(std::unique_ptr<AstLiteral>(addedLit));
574  }
575 
576  aggrVersions.push_back(newAggr);
577  }
578 
579  // Create the actual overall aggregator that ties the replacement aggregators together.
580  if (op == AstAggregator::min) {
581  // min x : { a(x) }. <=> min ( min x : { a1(x) }, min x : { a2(x) }, ... )
582  versions.push_back(combineAggregators(aggrVersions, BinaryOp::MIN));
583  } else if (op == AstAggregator::max) {
584  // max x : { a(x) }. <=> max ( max x : { a1(x) }, max x : { a2(x) }, ... )
585  versions.push_back(combineAggregators(aggrVersions, BinaryOp::MAX));
586  } else if (op == AstAggregator::count) {
587  // count : { a(x) }. <=> sum ( count : { a1(x) }, count : { a2(x) }, ... )
588  versions.push_back(combineAggregators(aggrVersions, BinaryOp::ADD));
589  } else if (op == AstAggregator::sum) {
590  // sum x : { a(x) }. <=> sum ( sum x : { a1(x) }, sum x : { a2(x) }, ... )
591  versions.push_back(combineAggregators(aggrVersions, BinaryOp::ADD));
592  } else {
593  assert(false && "Unsupported aggregator type");
594  }
595  }
596 
597  // Only perform one stage of inlining at a time.
598  if (changed) {
599  break;
600  }
601  }
602  }
603  } else if (dynamic_cast<const AstFunctor*>(arg)) {
604  // Each type of functor (unary, binary, ternary) must be handled differently.
605  if (const auto* functor = dynamic_cast<const AstUnaryFunctor*>(arg)) {
606  NullableVector<AstArgument*> argumentVersions =
607  getInlinedArgument(program, functor->getOperand());
608  if (argumentVersions.isValid()) {
609  changed = true;
610  for (AstArgument* newArg : argumentVersions.getVector()) {
611  AstArgument* newFunctor =
612  new AstUnaryFunctor(functor->getFunction(), std::unique_ptr<AstArgument>(newArg));
613  versions.push_back(newFunctor);
614  }
615  }
616  } else if (const auto* functor = dynamic_cast<const AstBinaryFunctor*>(arg)) {
617  NullableVector<AstArgument*> lhsVersions = getInlinedArgument(program, functor->getLHS());
618  if (lhsVersions.isValid()) {
619  changed = true;
620  for (AstArgument* newLhs : lhsVersions.getVector()) {
621  AstArgument* newFunctor =
622  new AstBinaryFunctor(functor->getFunction(), std::unique_ptr<AstArgument>(newLhs),
623  std::unique_ptr<AstArgument>(functor->getRHS()->clone()));
624  versions.push_back(newFunctor);
625  }
626  } else {
627  NullableVector<AstArgument*> rhsVersions = getInlinedArgument(program, functor->getRHS());
628  if (rhsVersions.isValid()) {
629  changed = true;
630  for (AstArgument* newRhs : rhsVersions.getVector()) {
631  AstArgument* newFunctor = new AstBinaryFunctor(functor->getFunction(),
632  std::unique_ptr<AstArgument>(functor->getLHS()->clone()),
633  std::unique_ptr<AstArgument>(newRhs));
634  versions.push_back(newFunctor);
635  }
636  }
637  }
638  } else if (const auto* functor = dynamic_cast<const AstTernaryFunctor*>(arg)) {
639  NullableVector<AstArgument*> leftVersions = getInlinedArgument(program, functor->getArg(0));
640  if (leftVersions.isValid()) {
641  changed = true;
642  for (AstArgument* newLeft : leftVersions.getVector()) {
643  AstArgument* newFunctor = new AstTernaryFunctor(functor->getFunction(),
644  std::unique_ptr<AstArgument>(newLeft),
645  std::unique_ptr<AstArgument>(functor->getArg(1)->clone()),
646  std::unique_ptr<AstArgument>(functor->getArg(2)->clone()));
647  versions.push_back(newFunctor);
648  }
649  } else {
650  NullableVector<AstArgument*> middleVersions = getInlinedArgument(program, functor->getArg(1));
651  if (middleVersions.isValid()) {
652  changed = true;
653  for (AstArgument* newMiddle : middleVersions.getVector()) {
654  AstArgument* newFunctor = new AstTernaryFunctor(functor->getFunction(),
655  std::unique_ptr<AstArgument>(functor->getArg(0)->clone()),
656  std::unique_ptr<AstArgument>(newMiddle),
657  std::unique_ptr<AstArgument>(functor->getArg(2)->clone()));
658  versions.push_back(newFunctor);
659  }
660  } else {
661  NullableVector<AstArgument*> rightVersions =
662  getInlinedArgument(program, functor->getArg(2));
663  if (rightVersions.isValid()) {
664  changed = true;
665  for (AstArgument* newRight : rightVersions.getVector()) {
666  AstArgument* newFunctor = new AstTernaryFunctor(functor->getFunction(),
667  std::unique_ptr<AstArgument>(functor->getArg(0)->clone()),
668  std::unique_ptr<AstArgument>(functor->getArg(1)->clone()),
669  std::unique_ptr<AstArgument>(newRight));
670  versions.push_back(newFunctor);
671  }
672  }
673  }
674  }
675  }
676  } else if (const auto* cast = dynamic_cast<const AstTypeCast*>(arg)) {
677  NullableVector<AstArgument*> argumentVersions = getInlinedArgument(program, cast->getValue());
678  if (argumentVersions.isValid()) {
679  changed = true;
680  for (AstArgument* newArg : argumentVersions.getVector()) {
681  AstArgument* newTypeCast =
682  new AstTypeCast(std::unique_ptr<AstArgument>(newArg), cast->getType());
683  versions.push_back(newTypeCast);
684  }
685  }
686  } else if (const auto* record = dynamic_cast<const AstRecordInit*>(arg)) {
687  std::vector<AstArgument*> recordArguments = record->getArguments();
688  for (size_t i = 0; i < recordArguments.size(); i++) {
689  AstArgument* currentRecArg = recordArguments[i];
690  NullableVector<AstArgument*> argumentVersions = getInlinedArgument(program, currentRecArg);
691  if (argumentVersions.isValid()) {
692  changed = true;
693  for (AstArgument* newArgumentVersion : argumentVersions.getVector()) {
694  auto* newRecordArg = new AstRecordInit();
695  for (size_t j = 0; j < recordArguments.size(); j++) {
696  if (i == j) {
697  newRecordArg->add(std::unique_ptr<AstArgument>(newArgumentVersion));
698  } else {
699  newRecordArg->add(std::unique_ptr<AstArgument>(recordArguments[j]->clone()));
700  }
701  }
702  versions.push_back(newRecordArg);
703  }
704  }
705 
706  // Only perform one stage of inlining at a time.
707  if (changed) {
708  break;
709  }
710  }
711  }
712 
713  if (changed) {
714  // Return a valid vector - replacements need to be made!
715  return NullableVector<AstArgument*>(versions);
716  } else {
717  // Return an invalid vector - no inlining has occurred
718  return NullableVector<AstArgument*>();
719  }
720 }
souffle::combineAggregators
AstArgument * combineAggregators(std::vector< AstAggregator * > aggrs, BinaryOp fun)
Definition: InlineRelationsTransformer.cpp:488
j
var j
Definition: htmlJsChartistMin.h:15
i
size_t i
Definition: json11.h:669

Returns a vector of arguments that should replace the given argument after one step of inlining...

Here is the call graph for this function:

NullableVector<AstAtom*> souffle::getInlinedAtom ( AstProgram &  program,
AstAtom &  atom 
)

Returns a vector of atoms that should replace the given atom after one step of inlining.

Assumes the relation the atom belongs to is not inlined itself.

Definition at line 726 of file InlineRelationsTransformer.cpp.

Referenced by getInlinedClause(), and getInlinedLiteral().

726  {
727  bool changed = false;
728  std::vector<AstAtom*> versions;
729 
730  // Try to inline each of the atom's arguments
731  std::vector<AstArgument*> arguments = atom.getArguments();
732  for (size_t i = 0; i < arguments.size(); i++) {
733  AstArgument* arg = arguments[i];
734 
735  NullableVector<AstArgument*> argumentVersions = getInlinedArgument(program, arg);
736 
737  if (argumentVersions.isValid()) {
738  // Argument has replacements
739  changed = true;
740 
741  // Create a new atom per new version of the argument
742  for (AstArgument* newArgument : argumentVersions.getVector()) {
743  AstAtom* newAtom = atom.clone();
744  newAtom->setArgument(i, std::unique_ptr<AstArgument>(newArgument));
745  versions.push_back(newAtom);
746  }

750  if (changed) {
751  break;
752  }
753  }

758  } else {

Here is the call graph for this function:

std::vector<AstClause*> souffle::getInlinedClause ( AstProgram &  program,
const AstClause &  clause 
)

Returns a list of clauses that should replace the given clause after one step of inlining.

If no inlining can occur, the list will only contain a clone of the original clause.

Definition at line 904 of file InlineRelationsTransformer.cpp.

References souffle::AstClause::addToBody(), souffle::AstClause::clone(), souffle::AstClause::cloneHead(), souffle::AstClause::getBodyLiterals(), souffle::AstClause::getHead(), getInlinedAtom(), getInlinedLiteral(), souffle::AstNode::getSrcLoc(), souffle::NullableVector< T >::getVector(), i, and souffle::NullableVector< T >::isValid().

Referenced by souffle::InlineRelationsTransformer::transform().

904  {
905  bool changed = false;
906  std::vector<AstClause*> versions;
907 
908  // Try to inline things contained in the arguments of the head first.
909  // E.g. `a(x, max y : { b(y) }) :- c(x).`, where b should be inlined.
910  AstAtom* head = clause.getHead();
911  NullableVector<AstAtom*> headVersions = getInlinedAtom(program, *head);
912  if (headVersions.isValid()) {
913  // The head atom can be inlined!
914  changed = true;
915 
916  // Produce the new clauses with the replacement head atoms
917  for (AstAtom* newHead : headVersions.getVector()) {
918  auto* newClause = new AstClause();
919  newClause->setSrcLoc(clause.getSrcLoc());
920 
921  newClause->setHead(std::unique_ptr<AstAtom>(newHead));
922 
923  // The body will remain unchanged
924  for (AstLiteral* lit : clause.getBodyLiterals()) {
925  newClause->addToBody(std::unique_ptr<AstLiteral>(lit->clone()));
926  }
927 
928  versions.push_back(newClause);
929  }
930  }
931 
932  // Only perform one stage of inlining at a time.
933  // If the head atoms did not need inlining, try inlining atoms nested in the body.
934  if (!changed) {
935  std::vector<AstLiteral*> bodyLiterals = clause.getBodyLiterals();
936  for (size_t i = 0; i < bodyLiterals.size(); i++) {
937  AstLiteral* currLit = bodyLiterals[i];
938 
939  // Three possible cases when trying to inline a literal:
940  // 1) The literal itself may be directly inlined. In this case, the atom can be replaced
941  // with multiple different bodies, as the inlined atom may have several rules.
942  // 2) Otherwise, the literal itself may not need to be inlined, but a subnode (e.g. an argument)
943  // may need to be inlined. In this case, an altered literal must replace the original.
944  // Again, several possible versions may exist, as the inlined relation may have several rules.
945  // 3) The literal does not depend on any inlined relations, and so does not need to be changed.
946  NullableVector<std::vector<AstLiteral*>> litVersions = getInlinedLiteral(program, currLit);
947 
948  if (litVersions.isValid()) {
949  // Case 1 and 2: Inlining has occurred!
950  changed = true;
951 
952  // The literal may be replaced with several different bodies.
953  // Create a new clause for each possible version.
954  std::vector<std::vector<AstLiteral*>> bodyVersions = litVersions.getVector();
955 
956  // Create the base clause with the current literal removed
957  auto baseClause = std::unique_ptr<AstClause>(clause.cloneHead());
958  for (AstLiteral* oldLit : bodyLiterals) {
959  if (currLit != oldLit) {
960  baseClause->addToBody(std::unique_ptr<AstLiteral>(oldLit->clone()));
961  }
962  }
963 
964  for (std::vector<AstLiteral*> body : bodyVersions) {
965  AstClause* replacementClause = baseClause->clone();
966 
967  // Add in the current set of literals replacing the inlined literal
968  // In Case 2, each body contains exactly one literal
969  for (AstLiteral* newLit : body) {
970  replacementClause->addToBody(std::unique_ptr<AstLiteral>(newLit));
971  }
972 
973  versions.push_back(replacementClause);
974  }
975  }
976 
977  // Only replace at most one literal per iteration
978  if (changed) {
979  break;
980  }
981  }
982  }
983 
984  if (!changed) {
985  // Case 3: No inlining changes, so a clone of the original should be returned
986  std::vector<AstClause*> ret;
987  ret.push_back(clause.clone());
988  return ret;
989  } else {
990  // Inlining changes, so return the replacement clauses.
991  return versions;
992  }
993 }
i
size_t i
Definition: json11.h:669
souffle::getInlinedAtom
NullableVector< AstAtom * > getInlinedAtom(AstProgram &program, AstAtom &atom)
Returns a vector of atoms that should replace the given atom after one step of inlining.
Definition: InlineRelationsTransformer.cpp:726
souffle::getInlinedLiteral
NullableVector< std::vector< AstLiteral * > > getInlinedLiteral(AstProgram &, AstLiteral *)
Tries to perform a single step of inlining on the given literal.
Definition: InlineRelationsTransformer.cpp:774

Here is the call graph for this function:

NullableVector< std::vector< AstLiteral * > > souffle::getInlinedLiteral ( AstProgram &  program,
AstLiteral *  lit 
)

Tries to perform a single step of inlining on the given literal.

Returns a pair of nullable vectors (v, w) such that:

  • v is valid if and only if the literal can be directly inlined, whereby it contains the bodies that replace it
  • if v is not valid, then w is valid if and only if the literal cannot be inlined directly, but contains a subargument that can be. In this case, it will contain the versions that will replace it.
  • If both are invalid, then no more inlining can occur on this literal and we are done.

Definition at line 774 of file InlineRelationsTransformer.cpp.

References EQ, formNegatedLiterals(), souffle::AstAtom::getAtom(), souffle::AstRelation::getClauses(), getInlinedArgument(), getInlinedAtom(), souffle::AstProgram::getRelation(), souffle::NullableVector< T >::getVector(), inlineBodyLiterals(), souffle::AstRelation::isInline(), souffle::NullableVector< T >::isValid(), and rel().

Referenced by getInlinedArgument(), and getInlinedClause().

774  {
775  bool inlined = false;
776  bool changed = false;
777 
778  std::vector<std::vector<AstLiteral*>> addedBodyLiterals;
779  std::vector<AstLiteral*> versions;
780 
781  if (auto* atom = dynamic_cast<AstAtom*>(lit)) {
782  // Check if this atom is meant to be inlined
783  AstRelation* rel = program.getRelation(atom->getName());
784 
785  if (rel->isInline()) {
786  // We found an atom in the clause that needs to be inlined!
787  // The clause needs to be replaced
788  inlined = true;
789 
790  // N new clauses should be formed, where N is the number of clauses
791  // associated with the inlined relation
792  for (AstClause* inClause : rel->getClauses()) {
793  // Form the replacement clause
794  std::pair<NullableVector<AstLiteral*>, std::vector<AstBinaryConstraint*>> inlineResult =
795  inlineBodyLiterals(atom, inClause);
796  NullableVector<AstLiteral*> replacementBodyLiterals = inlineResult.first;
797  std::vector<AstBinaryConstraint*> currConstraints = inlineResult.second;
798 
799  if (!replacementBodyLiterals.isValid()) {
800  // Failed to unify the atoms! We can skip this one...
801  continue;
802  }
803 
804  // Unification successful - the returned vector of literals represents one possible body
805  // replacement We can add in the unification constraints as part of these literals.
806  std::vector<AstLiteral*> bodyResult = replacementBodyLiterals.getVector();
807 
808  for (AstBinaryConstraint* cons : currConstraints) {
809  bodyResult.push_back(cons);
810  }
811 
812  addedBodyLiterals.push_back(bodyResult);
813  }
814  } else {
815  // Not meant to be inlined, but a subargument may be
816  NullableVector<AstAtom*> atomVersions = getInlinedAtom(program, *atom);
817  if (atomVersions.isValid()) {
818  // Subnode needs to be inlined, so we have a vector of replacement atoms
819  changed = true;
820  for (AstAtom* newAtom : atomVersions.getVector()) {
821  versions.push_back(newAtom);
822  }
823  }
824  }
825  } else if (auto* neg = dynamic_cast<AstNegation*>(lit)) {
826  // For negations, check the corresponding atom
827  AstAtom* atom = neg->getAtom();
828  NullableVector<std::vector<AstLiteral*>> atomVersions = getInlinedLiteral(program, atom);
829 
830  if (atomVersions.isValid()) {
831  // The atom can be inlined
832  inlined = true;
833 
834  if (atomVersions.getVector().empty()) {
835  // No clauses associated with the atom, so just becomes a true literal
836  std::vector<AstLiteral*> trueBody;
837  // TODO: change this to AstBoolean
838  trueBody.push_back(new AstBinaryConstraint(BinaryConstraintOp::EQ,
839  std::make_unique<AstNumberConstant>(1), std::make_unique<AstNumberConstant>(1)));
840  addedBodyLiterals.push_back(trueBody);
841  } else {
842  // Suppose an atom a(x) is inlined and has the following rules:
843  // - a(x) :- a11(x), a12(x).
844  // - a(x) :- a21(x), a22(x).
845  // Then, a(x) <- (a11(x) ^ a12(x)) v (a21(x) ^ a22(x))
846  // => !a(x) <- (!a11(x) v !a12(x)) ^ (!a21(x) v !a22(x))
847  // => !a(x) <- (!a11(x) ^ !a21(x)) v (!a11(x) ^ !a22(x)) v ...
848  // Essentially, produce every combination (m_1 ^ m_2 ^ ...) where m_i is a
849  // negated literal in the ith rule of a.
850  addedBodyLiterals = formNegatedLiterals(program, atom);
851  }
852  }
853  for (const auto& curVec : atomVersions.getVector()) {
854  for (auto* cur : curVec) {
855  delete cur;
856  }
857  }
858  } else if (auto* constraint = dynamic_cast<AstBinaryConstraint*>(lit)) {
859  NullableVector<AstArgument*> lhsVersions = getInlinedArgument(program, constraint->getLHS());
860  if (lhsVersions.isValid()) {
861  changed = true;
862  for (AstArgument* newLhs : lhsVersions.getVector()) {
863  AstLiteral* newLit = new AstBinaryConstraint(constraint->getOperator(),
864  std::unique_ptr<AstArgument>(newLhs),
865  std::unique_ptr<AstArgument>(constraint->getRHS()->clone()));
866  versions.push_back(newLit);
867  }
868  } else {
869  NullableVector<AstArgument*> rhsVersions = getInlinedArgument(program, constraint->getRHS());
870  if (rhsVersions.isValid()) {
871  changed = true;
872  for (AstArgument* newRhs : rhsVersions.getVector()) {
873  AstLiteral* newLit = new AstBinaryConstraint(constraint->getOperator(),
874  std::unique_ptr<AstArgument>(constraint->getLHS()->clone()),
875  std::unique_ptr<AstArgument>(newRhs));
876  versions.push_back(newLit);
877  }
878  }
879  }
880  }
881 
882  if (changed) {
883  // Not inlined directly but found replacement literals
884  // Rewrite these as single-literal bodies
885  for (AstLiteral* version : versions) {
886  std::vector<AstLiteral*> newBody;
887  newBody.push_back(version);
888  addedBodyLiterals.push_back(newBody);
889  }
890  inlined = true;
891  }
892 
893  if (inlined) {
894  return NullableVector<std::vector<AstLiteral*>>(addedBodyLiterals);
895  } else {
896  return NullableVector<std::vector<AstLiteral*>>();
897  }
898 }

TypeSet souffle::getLeastCommonSupertypes ( const Type &  a,
const Type &  b 
)

Computes the least common super types of the two given types.

Definition at line 409 of file TypeSystem.cpp.

References any_of(), souffle::TypeEnvironment::getAllTypes(), souffle::Type::getTypeEnvironment(), souffle::TypeSet::insert(), isSubtypeOf(), and souffle::TypeEnvironment::isType().

Referenced by getLeastCommonSupertypes().

409  {
410  // make sure they are in the same type environment
411  assert(a.getTypeEnvironment().isType(a) && a.getTypeEnvironment().isType(b));
412 
413  // if they are equal it is easy
414  if (a == b) {
415  return TypeSet(a);
416  }
417 
418  // equally simple - check whether one is a sub-type of the other
419  if (isSubtypeOf(a, b)) {
420  return TypeSet(b);
421  }
422  if (isSubtypeOf(b, a)) {
423  return TypeSet(a);
424  }
425 
426  // harder: no obvious relation => hard way
427  TypeSet superTypes;
428  TypeSet all = a.getTypeEnvironment().getAllTypes();
429  for (const Type& cur : all) {
430  if (isSubtypeOf(a, cur) && isSubtypeOf(b, cur)) {
431  superTypes.insert(cur);
432  }
433  }
434 
435  // filter out non-least super types
436  TypeSet res;
437  for (const Type& cur : superTypes) {
438  bool least = !any_of(superTypes, [&](const Type& t) { return t != cur && isSubtypeOf(t, cur); });
439  if (least) {
440  res.insert(cur);
441  }
442  }
443 
444  return res;
445 }
b
l j a showGridBackground &&c b raw series this eventEmitter b

bool isSubtypeOf(const Type &a, const Type &b)
Determines whether type a is a subtype of type b.

Here is the call graph for this function:

TypeSet souffle::getLeastCommonSupertypes ( const TypeSet &  set)

Computes the least common super types of all the types in the given set.

Definition at line 447 of file TypeSystem.cpp.

References souffle::TypeSet::begin(), souffle::TypeSet::empty(), souffle::TypeSet::end(), getLeastCommonSupertypes(), souffle::TypeSet::insert(), and souffle::TypeSet::isAll().

447  {
448  // handle the empty set
449  if (set.empty()) {
450  return set;
451  }
452 
453  // handle the all set => empty set (since no common super-type)
454  if (set.isAll()) {
455  return TypeSet();
456  }
457 
458  TypeSet res;
459  auto it = set.begin();
460  res.insert(*it);
461  ++it;
462 
463  // refine sub-set step by step
464  for (; it != set.end(); ++it) {
465  TypeSet tmp;
466  for (const Type& cur : res) {
467  tmp.insert(getLeastCommonSupertypes(cur, *it));
468  }
469  res = tmp;
470  }
471 
472  // done
473  return res;
474 }

The set of pair-wise least common super types of the types in the two given sets. ...

Here is the call graph for this function:

TypeSet souffle::getLeastCommonSupertypes ( const TypeSet &  a,
const TypeSet &  b 
)

The set of pair-wise least common super types of the types in the two given sets.

Definition at line 477 of file TypeSystem.cpp.

References b, souffle::TypeSet::empty(), getLeastCommonSupertypes(), souffle::TypeSet::insert(), souffle::TypeSet::isAll(), and x.

477  {
478  // special cases
479  if (a.empty()) {
480  return a;
481  }
482  if (b.empty()) {
483  return b;
484  }
485 
486  if (a.isAll()) {
487  return b;
488  }
489  if (b.isAll()) {
490  return a;
491  }
492 
493  // compute pairwise least common super types
494  TypeSet res;
495  for (const Type& x : a) {
496  for (const Type& y : b) {
497  res.insert(getLeastCommonSupertypes(x, y));
498  }
499  }
500  return res;
501 }
b
l j a showGridBackground &&c b raw series this eventEmitter b

547  int maxBound = -1;
548  int maxIndex = 0;

550

552  AstAtom* currAtom = atoms[i];
553  if (currAtom == nullptr) {
554  // already done - move on
555  continue;
556  }
557 
558  int numBound = 0;
559  for (AstArgument* arg : currAtom->getArguments()) {
560  if (isBoundArgument(arg, boundArgs, compositeBindings)) {
561  numBound++;
562  }
563  }
564 
565  if (numBound > maxBound) {
566  maxBound = numBound;
567  maxIndex = i;
568  maxIsEDB = contains(edb, currAtom->getName());
569  } else if (!maxIsEDB && numBound == maxBound && contains(edb, currAtom->getName())) {
570  // prioritise EDB predicates
571  maxIsEDB = true;
572  maxIndex = i;
573  }
574  }
575 
576  return maxIndex;

int souffle::getNextAtomMaxRatioSIPS ( std::vector< AstAtom * > &  atoms,
const std::set< std::string > &  boundArgs,
const std::set< AstRelationIdentifier > &  edb,
BindingStore &  compositeBindings 
)

Definition at line 580 of file MagicSet.cpp.

References souffle::AstAtom::getArguments(), souffle::AstAtom::getArity(), i, and isBoundArgument().

581  {
582  double maxRatio = -1;
583  int maxIndex = 0;
584 
585  for (size_t i = 0; i < atoms.size(); i++) {
586  AstAtom* currAtom = atoms[i];
587  if (currAtom == nullptr) {
588  // already done - move on
589  continue;
590  }
591 
592  int numArguments = currAtom->getArity();
593  if (numArguments == 0) {
594  return i; // no arguments!
595  }
596 
597  int numBound = 0;
598  for (AstArgument* arg : currAtom->getArguments()) {
599  if (isBoundArgument(arg, boundArgs, compositeBindings)) {
600  numBound++;
601  }
602  }
603 
604  double currRatio = numBound * 1.0 / numArguments;
605 
606  if (currRatio == 1) {
607  return i; // all bound, not going to get better than this
608  }
609 
610  if (currRatio > maxRatio) {
611  maxRatio = currRatio;
612  maxIndex = i;
613  }
614  }
615 
616  return maxIndex;
617 }
i
size_t i

Definition at line 504 of file MagicSet.cpp.

References contains(), souffle::AstAtom::getName(), hasBoundArgument(), and i.

505  {
506  // find the first available atom with at least one bound argument
507  int firstedb = -1;
508  int firstidb = -1;
509  for (size_t i = 0; i < atoms.size(); i++) {
510  AstAtom* currAtom = atoms[i];
511  if (currAtom == nullptr) {
512  // already done - move on
513  continue;
514  }
515 
516  AstRelationIdentifier atomName = currAtom->getName();
517 
518  // check if this is the first edb or idb atom met
519  if (contains(edb, atomName)) {
520  if (firstedb < 0) {
521  firstedb = i;
522  }
523  } else if (firstidb < 0) {
524  firstidb = i;
525  }
526 
527  // if it has at least one bound argument, then adorn this atom next
528  if (hasBoundArgument(currAtom, boundArgs, compositeBindings)) {
529  return i;
530  }
531  }
532 
533  // all unadorned body atoms only have free arguments
534  // choose the first edb remaining if available
535  if (firstedb >= 0) {
536  return firstedb;
537  } else {
538  return firstidb;
539  }
540 }
i

std::string souffle::getTypeQualifier ( const Type &  type)

Returns full type qualifier for a given type.

Definition at line 255 of file TypeSystem.cpp.

References souffle::UnionType::getElementTypes(), souffle::RecordType::getFields(), souffle::Type::getName(), isNumberType(), isRecordType(), isSymbolType(), seen, str, and toString().

255  {
256  struct visitor : public VisitOnceTypeVisitor<std::string> {
257  std::string visitUnionType(const UnionType& type) const override {
258  std::string str = visitType(type);
259  str += "[";
260  bool first = true;
261  for (auto unionType : type.getElementTypes()) {
262  if (first) {
263  first = false;
264  } else {
265  str += ",";
266  }
267  str += visit(*unionType);
268  }
269  str += "]";
270  return str;
271  }
272 
273  std::string visitRecordType(const RecordType& type) const override {
274  std::string str = visitType(type);
275  str += "{";
276  bool first = true;
277  for (auto field : type.getFields()) {
278  if (first) {
279  first = false;
280  } else {
281  str += ",";
282  }
283  str += field.name;
284  str += "#";
285  str += visit(field.type);
286  }
287  str += "}";
288  return str;
289  }
290 
291  std::string visitType(const Type& type) const override {
292  std::string str;
293  if (isNumberType(type)) {
294  str = "i:" + toString(type.getName());
295  } else if (isSymbolType(type)) {
296  str = "s:" + toString(type.getName());
297  } else if (isRecordType(type)) {
298  str = "r:" + toString(type.getName());
299  } else {
300  assert(false && "unknown type class");
301  }
302  seen[&type] = str;
303  return str;
304  }
305  };
306 
307  return visitor().visit(type);
308 }

std::pair<NullableVector<AstLiteral*>, std::vector<AstBinaryConstraint*> > souffle::inlineBodyLiterals ( AstAtom *  atom,
AstClause *  atomInlineClause 
)

Inlines the given atom based on a given clause.

Returns the vector of replacement literals and the necessary constraints. If unification is unsuccessful, the vector of literals is marked as invalid.

Definition at line 273 of file InlineRelationsTransformer.cpp.

References souffle::AstClause::apply(), souffle::AstClause::clone(), constraints, EQ, souffle::AstClause::getBodyLiterals(), souffle::AstClause::getHead(), souffle::NullableVector< T >::getVector(), souffle::NullableVector< T >::isValid(), and unifyAtoms().

Referenced by formNegatedLiterals(), and getInlinedLiteral().

274  {
275  bool changed = false;
276  std::vector<AstLiteral*> addedLits;
277  std::vector<AstBinaryConstraint*> constraints;
278 
279  // Rename the variables in the inlined clause to avoid conflicts when unifying multiple atoms
280  // - particularly when an inlined relation appears twice in a clause.
281  static int inlineCount = 0;
282 
283  // Make a temporary clone so we can rename variables without fear
284  AstClause* atomClause = atomInlineClause->clone();
285 
286  struct VariableRenamer : public AstNodeMapper {
287  int varnum;
288  VariableRenamer(int varnum) : varnum(varnum) {}
289  std::unique_ptr<AstNode> operator()(std::unique_ptr<AstNode> node) const override {
290  if (auto* var = dynamic_cast<AstVariable*>(node.get())) {
291  // Rename the variable
292  auto newVar = std::unique_ptr<AstVariable>(var->clone());
293  std::stringstream newName;
294  newName << "<inlined_" << var->getName() << "_" << varnum << ">";
295  newVar->setName(newName.str());
296  return std::move(newVar);
297  }
298  node->apply(*this);
299  return node;
300  }
301  };
302 
303  VariableRenamer update(inlineCount);
304  atomClause->apply(update);
305 
306  inlineCount++;
307 
308  // Get the constraints needed to unify the two atoms
309  NullableVector<std::pair<AstArgument*, AstArgument*>> res = unifyAtoms(atomClause->getHead(), atom);
310  if (res.isValid()) {
311  changed = true;
312  for (std::pair<AstArgument*, AstArgument*> pair : res.getVector()) {
313  constraints.push_back(new AstBinaryConstraint(BinaryConstraintOp::EQ,
314  std::unique_ptr<AstArgument>(pair.first->clone()),
315  std::unique_ptr<AstArgument>(pair.second->clone())));
316  }
317 
318  // Add in the body of the current clause of the inlined atom
319  for (AstLiteral* lit : atomClause->getBodyLiterals()) {
320  addedLits.push_back(lit->clone());
321  }
322  }
323 
324  delete atomClause;
325 
326  if (changed) {
327  return std::make_pair(NullableVector<AstLiteral*>(addedLits), constraints);
328  } else {
329  return std::make_pair(NullableVector<AstLiteral*>(), constraints);
330  }
331 }

122 
123  // a composite argument is bound iff all its subvariables are bound

bool souffle::isRecursiveType ( const Type &  type)

Determines whether the given type is a recursive type.

Definition at line 334 of file TypeSystem.cpp.

References any_of(), souffle::UnionType::getElementTypes(), and souffle::RecordType::getFields().

334  {
335  struct visitor : public VisitOnceTypeVisitor<bool> {
336  const Type& trg;
337  visitor(const Type& trg) : trg(trg) {}
338  bool visit(const Type& type) const override {
339  if (trg == type) {
340  return true;
341  }
342  return VisitOnceTypeVisitor<bool>::visit(type);
343  }
344  bool visitUnionType(const UnionType& type) const override {
345  auto reachesTrg = [&](const Type* cur) { return this->visit(*cur); };
346  return any_of(type.getElementTypes(), reachesTrg);
347  }
348  bool visitRecordType(const RecordType& type) const override {
349  auto reachesTrg = [&](const RecordType::Field& cur) { return this->visit(cur.type); };
350  return any_of(type.getFields(), reachesTrg);
351  }
352  };
353 
354  // record types are recursive if they contain themselves
355  if (const auto* r = dynamic_cast<const RecordType*>(&type)) {
356  auto reachesOrigin = visitor(type);
357  return any_of(r->getFields(),
358  [&](const RecordType::Field& field) -> bool { return reachesOrigin(field.type); });
359  }
360 
361  return false;
362 }

bool souffle::isSubtypeOf ( const Type &  a,
const Type &  b 
)

Determines whether type a is a subtype of type b.

Definition at line 364 of file TypeSystem.cpp.

References souffle::Type::getTypeEnvironment(), isNumberType(), and isSymbolType().

Referenced by souffle::TypeAnalysis::analyseTypes(), areSubtypesOf(), getGreatestCommonSubtypes(), and getLeastCommonSupertypes().

364  {
365  // make sure they are both in the same environment
366  auto& environment = a.getTypeEnvironment();
367  assert(environment.isType(a) && environment.isType(b));
368 
369  // first check - a type is a sub-type of itself
370  if (a == b) {
371  return true;
372  }
373 
374  // check for predefined types
375  if (b == environment.getNumberType()) {
376  return isNumberType(a);
377  }
378  if (b == environment.getSymbolType()) {
379  return isSymbolType(a);
380  }
381 
382  // check primitive type chains
383  if (isA<PrimitiveType>(a)) {
384  if (isSubtypeOf(as<PrimitiveType>(a).getBaseType(), b)) {
385  return true;
386  }
387  }
388 
389  // next - if b is a union type
390  if (isUnion(b)) {
391  return isSubType(a, as<UnionType>(b));
392  }
393 
394  // done
395  return false;
396 }

bool souffle::isValidMove ( const AstClause *  left,
size_t  leftIdx,
const AstClause *  right,
size_t  rightIdx 
)

Check if the atom at leftIdx in the left clause can potentially be matched up with the atom at rightIdx in the right clause.

NOTE: index 0 refers to the head atom, index 1 to the first body atom, and so on.

Definition at line 122 of file MinimiseProgramTransformer.cpp.

References souffle::AstLiteral::getAtom(), souffle::AstAtom::getAtom(), souffle::AstClause::getBodyLiteral(), souffle::AstClause::getHead(), and souffle::AstAtom::getName().

Referenced by areBijectivelyEquivalent().

122  {
123  // invalid indices
124  if (leftIdx < 0 || rightIdx < 0) {
125  return false;
126  }
127 
128  // handle the case where one of the indices refers to the head
129  if (leftIdx == 0 && rightIdx == 0) {
130  const AstAtom* leftHead = left->getHead()->getAtom();
131  const AstAtom* rightHead = right->getHead()->getAtom();
132  return leftHead->getName() == rightHead->getName();
133  } else if (leftIdx == 0 || rightIdx == 0) {
134  return false;
135  }
136 
137  // both must hence be body atoms
138  int leftBodyAtomIdx = leftIdx - 1;
139  const AstAtom* leftAtom = left->getBodyLiteral(leftBodyAtomIdx)->getAtom();
140 
141  int rightBodyAtomIdx = rightIdx - 1;
142  const AstAtom* rightAtom = right->getBodyLiteral(rightBodyAtomIdx)->getAtom();
143 
144  return leftAtom->getName() == rightAtom->getName();
145 }

Here is the call graph for this function:

bool souffle::isValidPermutation ( const AstClause *  left,
const AstClause *  right,
const std::vector< unsigned int > &  permutation 
)

Check whether a valid variable mapping exists for the given permutation.

Definition at line 150 of file MinimiseProgramTransformer.cpp.

References souffle::AstClause::clone(), souffle::AstClause::getBodyLiterals(), souffle::AstClause::getHead(), souffle::AstVariable::getName(), getName, i, j, and visitDepthFirst().

Referenced by areBijectivelyEquivalent().

151  {
152  // --- perform the permutation ---
153 
154  auto reorderedLeft = std::unique_ptr<AstClause>(left->clone());
155 
156  // deduce the body atom permutation from the full clause permutation
157  std::vector<unsigned int> bodyPermutation(permutation.begin() + 1, permutation.end());
158  for (size_t i = 0; i < bodyPermutation.size(); i++) {
159  bodyPermutation[i] -= 1;
160  }
161 
162  // currently, <permutation[i] == j> indicates that atom i should map to position j
163  // internally, for the clause class' reordering function, <permutation[i] == j> indicates
164  // that position i should contain atom j
165  // rearrange the permutation to match the internals
166  // TODO (azreika): perhaps change the internal reordering strategy because this came up in MST too
167  std::vector<unsigned int> reorderedPermutation(bodyPermutation.size());
168  for (size_t i = 0; i < bodyPermutation.size(); i++) {
169  reorderedPermutation[bodyPermutation[i]] = i;
170  }
171 
172  // perform the permutation
173  reorderedLeft->reorderAtoms(reorderedPermutation);
174 
175  // --- check if a valid variable exists corresponding to this permutation ---
176 
177  std::map<std::string, std::string> variableMap;
178  visitDepthFirst(*reorderedLeft, [&](const AstVariable& var) { variableMap[var.getName()] = ""; });
179 
180  // need to match the variables in the body
181  std::vector<AstLiteral*> leftAtoms = reorderedLeft->getBodyLiterals();
182  std::vector<AstLiteral*> rightAtoms = right->getBodyLiterals();
183 
184  // need to match the variables in the head
185  leftAtoms.push_back(reorderedLeft->getHead());
186  rightAtoms.push_back(right->getHead());
187 
188  // check if a valid variable mapping exists
189  auto isVariable = [&](const AstArgument* arg) {
190  return dynamic_cast<const AstVariable*>(arg) != nullptr;
191  };
192 
193  auto isConstant = [&](const AstArgument* arg) {
194  return dynamic_cast<const AstConstant*>(arg) != nullptr;
195  };
196 
197  bool validMapping = true;
198  for (size_t i = 0; i < leftAtoms.size() && validMapping; i++) {
199  // match arguments
200  std::vector<AstArgument*> leftArgs = leftAtoms[i]->getAtom()->getArguments();
201  std::vector<AstArgument*> rightArgs = rightAtoms[i]->getAtom()->getArguments();
202 
203  for (size_t j = 0; j < leftArgs.size(); j++) {
204  AstArgument* leftArg = leftArgs[j];
205  AstArgument* rightArg = rightArgs[j];
206  if (isVariable(leftArg) && isVariable(rightArg)) {
207  // both variables, their names should match to each other through the clause
208  std::string leftVarName = dynamic_cast<AstVariable*>(leftArg)->getName();
209  std::string rightVarName = dynamic_cast<AstVariable*>(rightArg)->getName();
210 
211  std::string currentMap = variableMap[leftVarName];
212  if (currentMap.empty()) {
213  // unassigned yet, so assign it appropriately
214  variableMap[leftVarName] = rightVarName;
215  } else if (currentMap != rightVarName) {
216  // mapping is inconsistent!
217  // clauses cannot be equivalent under this permutation
218  validMapping = false;
219  break;
220  }
221  } else if (isConstant(leftArg) && isConstant(rightArg)) {
222  // check if its the same constant
223  auto leftCst = dynamic_cast<AstConstant*>(leftArg)->getIndex();
224  auto rightCst = dynamic_cast<AstConstant*>(rightArg)->getIndex();
225 
226  if (leftCst != rightCst) {
227  // constants don't match, failed!
228  validMapping = false;
229  break;
230  }
231  } else {
232  // not the same type, failed!
233  validMapping = false;
234  break;
235  }
236  }
237  }
238 
239  // return whether a valid variable mapping exists for this permutation
240  return validMapping;
241 }

174  ""}, // main option, the datalog program itself, key is always empty
