216 
217  Global::config().set("version", PACKAGE_VERSION);
218  // ------ command line arguments -------------
219 
220  /* for the help option, if given simply print the help text then exit */
221  if (!Global::config().has("") || Global::config().has("help")) {
222  std::cerr << Global::config().help();
223  return 0;
224  }
225 
226  /* check that datalog program exists */
227  if (!existFile(Global::config().get(""))) {
228  throw std::runtime_error("cannot open file " + std::string(Global::config().get("")));
229  }
230 
231  /* for the jobs option, to determine the number of threads used */
232  if (Global::config().has("jobs")) {
233 #ifdef _OPENMP
234  if (isNumber(Global::config().get("jobs").c_str())) {
235  if (std::stoi(Global::config().get("jobs")) < 1) {
236  throw std::runtime_error(
237  "Number of jobs in the -j/--jobs options must be greater than zero!");
238  }
239  } else {
240  if (!Global::config().has("jobs", "auto")) {
241  throw std::runtime_error(
242  "Wrong parameter " + Global::config().get("jobs") + " for option -j/--jobs!");
243  }
244  Global::config().set("jobs", "0");
245  }
246 #else
247  // Check that -j option has not been changed from the default
248  if (Global::config().get("jobs") != "1") {
249  std::cerr << "\nWarning: OpenMP is not enabled\n";
250  }
251 #endif
252  } else {
253  throw std::runtime_error(
254  "Wrong parameter " + Global::config().get("jobs") + " for option -j/--jobs!");
255  }
256 
257  /* if an output directory is given, check it exists */
258  if (Global::config().has("output-dir") && !Global::config().has("output-dir", "-") &&
259  !existDir(Global::config().get("output-dir")) &&
260  !(Global::config().has("generate") ||
261  (Global::config().has("dl-program") && !Global::config().has("compile")))) {
262  throw std::runtime_error(
263  "output directory " + Global::config().get("output-dir") + " does not exists");
264  }
265 
266  /* collect all input directories for the c pre-processor */
267  if (Global::config().has("include-dir")) {
268  std::string currentInclude = "";
269  std::string allIncludes = "";
270  for (const char& ch : Global::config().get("include-dir")) {
271  if (ch == ' ') {
272  if (!existDir(currentInclude)) {
273  throw std::runtime_error("include directory " + currentInclude + " does not exists");
274  } else {
275  allIncludes += " -I";
276  allIncludes += currentInclude;
277  currentInclude = "";
278  }
279  } else {
280  currentInclude += ch;
281  }
282  }
283  allIncludes += " -I" + currentInclude;
284  Global::config().set("include-dir", allIncludes);
285  }
286 
287  /* turn on compilation of executables */
288  if (Global::config().has("dl-program")) {
289  Global::config().set("compile");
290  }
291 
292  /* disable provenance with engine option */
293  if (Global::config().has("provenance")) {
294  if (Global::config().has("engine")) {
295  throw std::runtime_error("provenance cannot be enabled with distributed execution.");
296  }
297  }
298 
299  /* ensure that souffle has been compiled with support for the execution engine, if specified */
300  if (Global::config().has("engine")) {
301  if (!(Global::config().has("compile") || Global::config().has("dl-program") ||
302  Global::config().has("generate"))) {
303  throw std::invalid_argument("Error: Use of engine option not yet available for interpreter.");
304  }
305  const auto& engine = Global::config().get("engine");
306  if (engine != "file" && engine != "mpi") {
307  throw std::invalid_argument("Error: Use of engine '" + engine + "' is not supported.");
308  }
309 #ifndef USE_MPI
310  if (engine == "mpi") {
311  throw std::invalid_argument("Error: Use of engine '" + engine +
312  "' requires configure option '--enable-" + engine + "'.");
313  }
314  if (Global::config().has("hostfile")) {
315  throw std::invalid_argument(
316  "Error: Use of hostfile option requires configure option '--enable-" + engine + "'.");
317  }
318 #else
319  if (engine != "mpi" && Global::config().has("hostfile")) {
320  throw std::invalid_argument(
321  "Error: Use of hostfile option requires execution engine '" + engine + "'.");
322  }
323 #endif
324  }
325 
326  if (Global::config().has("live-profile") && !Global::config().has("profile")) {
327  Global::config().set("profile");
328  }
329  } catch (std::exception& e) {
330  std::cerr << e.what() << std::endl;
331  exit(1);
332  }
333 
334  // ------ start souffle -------------
335 
336  std::string souffleExecutable = which(argv[0]);
337 
338  if (souffleExecutable.empty()) {
339  throw std::runtime_error("failed to determine souffle executable path");
340  }
341 
342  /* Create the pipe to establish a communication between cpp and souffle */
343  std::string cmd = ::which("mcpp");
344 
345  if (!isExecutable(cmd)) {
346  throw std::runtime_error("failed to locate mcpp pre-processor");
347  }
348 
349  cmd += " -W0 " + Global::config().get("include-dir") + " " + Global::config().get("");
350  FILE* in = popen(cmd.c_str(), "r");
351 
352  /* Time taking for parsing */
353  auto parser_start = std::chrono::high_resolution_clock::now();
354 
355  // ------- parse program -------------
356 
357  // parse file
358  SymbolTable symTab;
359  ErrorReport errReport(Global::config().has("no-warn"));
360  DebugReport debugReport;
361  std::unique_ptr<AstTranslationUnit> astTranslationUnit =
362  ParserDriver::parseTranslationUnit("<stdin>", in, symTab, errReport, debugReport);
363 
364  // close input pipe
365  int preprocessor_status = pclose(in);
366  if (preprocessor_status == -1) {
367  perror(nullptr);
368  throw std::runtime_error("failed to close pre-processor pipe");
369  }
370 
371  /* Report run-time of the parser if verbose flag is set */
372  if (Global::config().has("verbose")) {
373  auto parser_end = std::chrono::high_resolution_clock::now();
374  std::cout << "Parse Time: " << std::chrono::duration<double>(parser_end - parser_start).count()
375  << "sec\n";
376  }
377 
378  // ------- check for parse errors -------------
379  if (astTranslationUnit->getErrorReport().getNumErrors() != 0) {
380  std::cerr << astTranslationUnit->getErrorReport();
381  std::cerr << std::to_string(astTranslationUnit->getErrorReport().getNumErrors()) +
382  " errors generated, evaluation aborted"
383  << std::endl;
384  exit(1);
385  }
386 
387  // ------- rewriting / optimizations -------------
388 
389  /* set up additional global options based on pragma declaratives */
390  (std::make_unique<AstPragmaChecker>())->apply(*astTranslationUnit);
391 
392  /* construct the transformation pipeline */
393 
394  // Magic-Set pipeline
395  auto magicPipeline = std::make_unique<ConditionalTransformer>(Global::config().has("magic-transform"),
396  std::make_unique<PipelineTransformer>(std::make_unique<NormaliseConstraintsTransformer>(),
397  std::make_unique<MagicSetTransformer>(), std::make_unique<ResolveAliasesTransformer>(),
398  std::make_unique<RemoveRelationCopiesTransformer>(),
399  std::make_unique<RemoveEmptyRelationsTransformer>(),
400  std::make_unique<RemoveRedundantRelationsTransformer>()));
401 
402  // Equivalence pipeline
403  auto equivalencePipeline =
404  std::make_unique<PipelineTransformer>(std::make_unique<MinimiseProgramTransformer>(),
405  std::make_unique<RemoveRelationCopiesTransformer>(),
406  std::make_unique<RemoveEmptyRelationsTransformer>(),
407  std::make_unique<RemoveRedundantRelationsTransformer>());
408 
409 #ifdef USE_PROVENANCE
410  // Provenance pipeline
411  auto provenancePipeline = std::make_unique<PipelineTransformer>(std::make_unique<ConditionalTransformer>(
412  Global::config().has("provenance"), std::make_unique<ProvenanceTransformer>()));
413 #else
414  auto provenancePipeline = std::make_unique<PipelineTransformer>();
415 #endif
416 
417  // Main pipeline
418  auto pipeline = std::make_unique<PipelineTransformer>(std::make_unique<AstComponentChecker>(),
419  std::make_unique<ComponentInstantiationTransformer>(),
420  std::make_unique<UniqueAggregationVariablesTransformer>(), std::make_unique<AstSemanticChecker>(),
421  std::make_unique<RemoveBooleanConstraintsTransformer>(),
422  std::make_unique<ReplaceSingletonVariablesTransformer>(),
423  std::make_unique<InlineRelationsTransformer>(), std::make_unique<ReduceExistentialsTransformer>(),
424  std::make_unique<PartitionBodyLiteralsTransformer>(),
425  std::make_unique<ResolveAliasesTransformer>(),
426  std::make_unique<RemoveRelationCopiesTransformer>(), std::move(equivalencePipeline),
427  std::make_unique<MaterializeAggregationQueriesTransformer>(),
428  std::make_unique<RemoveEmptyRelationsTransformer>(),
429  std::make_unique<RemoveRedundantRelationsTransformer>(), std::move(magicPipeline),
430  std::make_unique<AstExecutionPlanChecker>(), std::move(provenancePipeline));
431 
432  // Disable unwanted transformations
433  if (Global::config().has("disable-transformers")) {
434  // TODO (azreika): add splitter into utils
435  auto split = [&](std::string str, char delimiter) {
436  std::set<std::string> parts;
437 
438  int begin = 0;
439  for (size_t i = 0; i < str.size(); i++) {
440  if (str[i] == delimiter) {
441  std::string token = str.substr(begin, (i - begin));
442  parts.insert(token);
443  begin = i + 1;
444  }
445  }
446 
447  parts.insert(str.substr(begin)); // add in the last remaining token
448  parts.erase(""); // remove empty tokens
449 
450  return parts;
451  };
452 
453  std::set<std::string> givenTransformers = split(Global::config().get("disable-transformers"), ',');
454  pipeline->disableTransformers(givenTransformers);
455  }
456 
457  // Set up the debug report if necessary
458  if (!Global::config().get("debug-report").empty()) {
459  auto parser_end = std::chrono::high_resolution_clock::now();
460  std::string runtimeStr =
461  "(" + std::to_string(std::chrono::duration<double>(parser_end - parser_start).count()) + "s)";
462  DebugReporter::generateDebugReport(*astTranslationUnit, "Parsing", "After Parsing " + runtimeStr);
463 
464  pipeline->setDebugReport();
465  }
466 
467  // Toggle pipeline verbosity
468  pipeline->setVerbosity(Global::config().has("verbose"));
469 
470  // Apply all the transformations
471  pipeline->apply(*astTranslationUnit);
472 
473  // ------- execution -------------
474 
475  /* translate AST to RAM */
476  std::unique_ptr<RamTranslationUnit> ramTranslationUnit =
477  AstTranslator().translateUnit(*astTranslationUnit);
478 
479  std::vector<std::unique_ptr<RamTransformer>> ramTransforms;
480  ramTransforms.push_back(std::make_unique<RamSemanticChecker>());
481 
482  for (const auto& transform : ramTransforms) {
483  transform->apply(*ramTranslationUnit);
484 
485  /* Abort evaluation of the program if errors were encountered */
486  if (ramTranslationUnit->getErrorReport().getNumErrors() != 0) {
487  std::cerr << ramTranslationUnit->getErrorReport();
488  std::cerr << std::to_string(ramTranslationUnit->getErrorReport().getNumErrors()) +
489  " errors generated, evaluation aborted"
490  << std::endl;
491  exit(1);
492  }
493  }
494  if (ramTranslationUnit->getErrorReport().getNumIssues() != 0) {
495  std::cerr << ramTranslationUnit->getErrorReport();
496  }
497 
498  if (!ramTranslationUnit->getProgram()->getMain()) {
499  return 0;
500  };
501 
502  if (!Global::config().has("compile") && !Global::config().has("dl-program") &&
503  !Global::config().has("generate")) {
504  // ------- interpreter -------------
505 
506  // configure interpreter
507  std::unique_ptr<Interpreter> interpreter = std::make_unique<Interpreter>(*ramTranslationUnit);
508 
509  std::thread profiler;
510  // Start up profiler if needed
511  if (Global::config().has("live-profile") && !Global::config().has("compile")) {
512  profiler = std::thread([]() { profile::Tui().runProf(); });
513  }
514  // execute translation unit
515  interpreter->executeMain();
516 
517  // If the profiler was started, join back here once it exits.
518  if (profiler.joinable()) {
519  profiler.join();
520  }
521 
522 #ifdef USE_PROVENANCE
523  // only run explain interface if interpreted
524  if (Global::config().has("provenance")) {
525  // construct SouffleProgram from env
526  InterpreterProgInterface interface(*interpreter);
527  if (Global::config().get("provenance") == "1") {
528  explain(interface, true, false);
529  } else if (Global::config().get("provenance") == "2") {
530  explain(interface, true, true);
531  }
532  }
533 #endif
534 
535  } else {
536  // ------- compiler -------------
537 
538  std::string compileCmd = ::findTool("souffle-compile", souffleExecutable, ".");
539  /* Fail if a souffle-compile executable is not found */
540  if (!isExecutable(compileCmd)) {
541  throw std::runtime_error("failed to locate souffle-compile");
542  }
543  compileCmd += " ";
544 
545  std::unique_ptr<Synthesiser> synthesiser = std::make_unique<Synthesiser>();
546 
547  try {
548  // Find the base filename for code generation and execution
549  std::string baseFilename;
550  if (Global::config().has("dl-program")) {
551  baseFilename = Global::config().get("dl-program");
552  } else if (Global::config().has("generate")) {
553  baseFilename = Global::config().get("generate");
554  // trim .cpp extension if it exists
555  if (baseFilename.size() >= 4 && baseFilename.substr(baseFilename.size() - 4) == ".cpp") {
556  baseFilename = baseFilename.substr(0, baseFilename.size() - 4);
557  }
558  } else {
559  baseFilename = tempFile();
560  }
561  if (baseName(baseFilename) == "/" || baseName(baseFilename) == ".") {
562  baseFilename = tempFile();
563  }
564 
565  std::string baseIdentifier = identifier(simpleName(baseFilename));
566  std::string sourceFilename = baseFilename + ".cpp";
567 
568  std::ofstream os(sourceFilename);
569  synthesiser->generateCode(*ramTranslationUnit, os, baseIdentifier);
570  os.close();
571 
572  if (Global::config().has("compile")) {
573  auto start = std::chrono::high_resolution_clock::now();
574  compileToBinary(compileCmd, sourceFilename);
575  /* Report overall run-time in verbose mode */
576  if (Global::config().has("verbose")) {
577  auto end = std::chrono::high_resolution_clock::now();
578  std::cout << "Compilation Time: " << std::chrono::duration<double>(end - start).count()
579  << "sec\n";
580  }
581  // run compiled C++ program if requested.
582  if (!Global::config().has("dl-program")) {
583  executeBinary(baseFilename
584 #ifdef USE_MPI
585  ,
586  ((int)astTranslationUnit->getAnalysis<SCCGraph>()->getNumberOfSCCs()) + 1
587 #endif
588  );
589  }
590  }
591  } catch (std::exception& e) {
592  std::cerr << e.what() << std::endl;
593  std::exit(1);
594  }
595  }
596 
597 // finalize mpi, this is necessary for the symbol table
598 #ifdef USE_MPI
599  mpi::finalize();
600 #endif
601 
602  /* Report overall run-time in verbose mode */
603  if (Global::config().has("verbose")) {
604  auto souffle_end = std::chrono::high_resolution_clock::now();
605  std::cout << "Total Time: " << std::chrono::duration<double>(souffle_end - souffle_start).count()
606  << "sec\n";
607  }
608 
609  return 0;
610 }

Removes all underscores in all atoms of inlined relations.

116  {
117  struct M : public AstNodeMapper {
118  const std::set<AstRelationIdentifier> inlinedRelations;
119  bool replaceUnderscores;
120 
121  M(std::set<AstRelationIdentifier> inlinedRelations, bool replaceUnderscores)
122  : inlinedRelations(std::move(inlinedRelations)), replaceUnderscores(replaceUnderscores) {}
123 
124  std::unique_ptr<AstNode> operator()(std::unique_ptr<AstNode> node) const override {
125  static int underscoreCount = 0;
126 
127  if (!replaceUnderscores) {
128  // Check if we should start replacing underscores for this node's subnodes
129  if (auto* atom = dynamic_cast<AstAtom*>(node.get())) {
130  if (inlinedRelations.find(atom->getName()) != inlinedRelations.end()) {
131  // Atom associated with an inlined relation, so replace the underscores
132  // in all of its subnodes with named variables.
133  M replace(inlinedRelations, true);
134  node->apply(replace);
135  return node;
136  }
137  }
138  } else if (dynamic_cast<AstUnnamedVariable*>(node.get())) {
139  // Give a unique name to the underscored variable
140  // TODO (azreika): need a more consistent way of handling internally generated variables in
141  // general
142  std::stringstream newVarName;
143  newVarName << "<underscore_" << underscoreCount++ << ">";
144  return std::make_unique<AstVariable>(newVarName.str());
145  }
146 
147  node->apply(*this);
148  return node;
149  }
150  };
151 
152  // Store the names of all relations to be inlined
153  std::set<AstRelationIdentifier> inlinedRelations;
154  for (AstRelation* rel : program.getRelations()) {
155  if (rel->isInline()) {
156  inlinedRelations.insert(rel->getName());
157  }
158  }
159 
160  // Apply the renaming procedure to the entire program
161  M update(inlinedRelations, false);
162  program.apply(update);
163 }

void souffle::normaliseInlinedHeads ( AstProgram &  program)

Replace constants in the head of inlined clauses with (constrained) variables.

Definition at line 66 of file InlineRelationsTransformer.cpp.

References EQ, souffle::AstProgram::getRelations(), rel(), and souffle::AstProgram::removeClause().

Referenced by souffle::InlineRelationsTransformer::transform().

66  {
67  static int newVarCount = 0;
68 
69  // Go through the clauses of all inlined relations
70  for (AstRelation* rel : program.getRelations()) {
71  if (!rel->isInline()) {
72  break;
73  }
74 
75  for (AstClause* clause : rel->getClauses()) {
76  // Set up the new clause with an empty body and no arguments in the head
77  auto newClause = std::make_unique<AstClause>();
78  newClause->setSrcLoc(clause->getSrcLoc());
79  auto clauseHead = std::make_unique<AstAtom>(clause->getHead()->getName());
80 
81  // Add in everything in the original body
82  for (AstLiteral* lit : clause->getBodyLiterals()) {
83  newClause->addToBody(std::unique_ptr<AstLiteral>(lit->clone()));
84  }
85 
86  // Set up the head arguments in the new clause
87  for (AstArgument* arg : clause->getHead()->getArguments()) {
88  if (auto* constant = dynamic_cast<AstConstant*>(arg)) {
89  // Found a constant in the head, so replace it with a variable
90  std::stringstream newVar;
91  newVar << "<new_var_" << newVarCount++ << ">";
92  clauseHead->addArgument(std::make_unique<AstVariable>(newVar.str()));
93 
94  // Add a body constraint to set the variable's value to be the original constant
95  newClause->addToBody(std::make_unique<AstBinaryConstraint>(BinaryConstraintOp::EQ,
96  std::make_unique<AstVariable>(newVar.str()),
97  std::unique_ptr<AstArgument>(constant->clone())));
98  } else {
99  // Already a variable
100  clauseHead->addArgument(std::unique_ptr<AstArgument>(arg->clone()));
101  }
102  }
103 
104  newClause->setHead(std::move(clauseHead));
105 
106  // Replace the old clause with this one
107  rel->addClause(std::move(newClause));
108  program.removeClause(clause);
109  }
110  }
111 }

bool souffle::reduceSubstitution ( std::vector< std::pair< AstArgument *, AstArgument * >> &  sub)

Reduces a vector of substitutions.

Returns false only if matched argument pairs are found to be incompatible.

Definition at line 185 of file InlineRelationsTransformer.cpp.

References i, lhs, rhs, and sub().

Referenced by unifyAtoms().

185  {
186  // Type-Checking functions
187  auto isConstant = [&](AstArgument* arg) { return (dynamic_cast<AstConstant*>(arg)); };
188  auto isRecord = [&](AstArgument* arg) { return (dynamic_cast<AstRecordInit*>(arg)); };
189 
190  // Keep trying to reduce the substitutions until we reach a fixed point.
191  // Note that at this point no underscores ('_') or counters ('$') should appear.
192  bool done = false;
193  while (!done) {
194  done = true;
195 
196  // Try reducing each pair by one step
197  for (size_t i = 0; i < sub.size(); i++) {
198  auto currPair = sub[i];
199  AstArgument* lhs = currPair.first;
200  AstArgument* rhs = currPair.second;
201 
202  // Start trying to reduce the substitution
203  // Note: Can probably go further with this substitution reduction
204  if (*lhs == *rhs) {
205  // Get rid of redundant `x = x`
206  sub.erase(sub.begin() + i);
207  done = false;
208  } else if (isConstant(lhs) && isConstant(rhs)) {
209  // Both are constants but not equal (prev case => !=)
210  // Failed to unify!
211  return false;
212  } else if (isRecord(lhs) && isRecord(rhs)) {
213  // Note: we will not deal with the case where only one side is
214  // a record and the other is a variable, as variables can be records
215  // on a deeper level.
216  std::vector<AstArgument*> lhsArgs = static_cast<AstRecordInit*>(lhs)->getArguments();
217  std::vector<AstArgument*> rhsArgs = static_cast<AstRecordInit*>(rhs)->getArguments();
218 
219  if (lhsArgs.size() != rhsArgs.size()) {
220  // Records of unequal size can't be equated
221  return false;
222  }
223 
224  // Equate all corresponding arguments
225  for (size_t i = 0; i < lhsArgs.size(); i++) {
226  sub.push_back(std::make_pair(lhsArgs[i], rhsArgs[i]));
227  }
228 
229  // Get rid of the record equality
230  sub.erase(sub.begin() + i);
231  done = false;
232  } else if ((isRecord(lhs) && isConstant(rhs)) || (isConstant(lhs) && isRecord(rhs))) {
233  // A record =/= a constant
234  return false;
235  }
236  }
237  }
238 
239  return true;
240 }

std::vector<unsigned int> souffle::reorderOrdering ( std::vector< unsigned int >  order)

Definition at line 444 of file MagicSet.cpp.

References i.

Referenced by souffle::MagicSetTransformer::transform().

444  {
445  // when the adornment is computed, the atoms are numbered based on
446  // which was chosen by the SIPS first - this is the 'order' vector.
447  // want to reorder clause atoms so that the atom labelled 0 is first, and so on.
448  // i.e. order[i] denotes where labels[i] should move
449  // e.g.: [a, b, c] with label [1, 2, 0] should become [c, a, b]
450 
451  // the atom reordering function for clauses, however, moves it as follows:
452  // [a, b, c] with label [1, 2, 0] becomes [b, c, a]
453  // i.e. labels[i] goes to the position of i in the order vector
454 
455  // this function reorders the ordering scheme to match the second type
456  std::vector<unsigned int> neworder(order.size());
457  for (size_t i = 0; i < order.size(); i++) {
458  // this took embarrassingly long to figure out
459  neworder[order[i]] = i;
460  }
461  return neworder;
462 }

inline

Converts symbolic representation of an operator to the operator.

Definition at line 114 of file BinaryConstraintOps.h.

References __UNDEFINED__, CONTAINS, EQ, GE, GT, LE, LT, MATCH, NE, NOT_CONTAINS, and NOT_MATCH.

114  {
115  if (symbol == "=") return BinaryConstraintOp::EQ;
116  if (symbol == "!=") return BinaryConstraintOp::NE;
117  if (symbol == "<") return BinaryConstraintOp::LT;
118  if (symbol == "<=") return BinaryConstraintOp::LE;
119  if (symbol == ">=") return BinaryConstraintOp::GE;
120  if (symbol == ">") return BinaryConstraintOp::GT;
121  if (symbol == "match") return BinaryConstraintOp::MATCH;
122  if (symbol == "contains") return BinaryConstraintOp::CONTAINS;
123  if (symbol == "not_match") return BinaryConstraintOp::NOT_MATCH;
124  if (symbol == "not_contains") return BinaryConstraintOp::NOT_CONTAINS;
125  std::cout << "Unrecognised operator: " << symbol << "\n";
126  assert(false && "Unsupported Operator!");
127  return BinaryConstraintOp::__UNDEFINED__;
128 }

119  // transitive clause: A(x, z) :- A(x, y), A(y, z).

NullableVector<std::pair<AstArgument*, AstArgument*> > souffle::unifyAtoms ( AstAtom *  first,
AstAtom *  second 
)

Returns the nullable vector of substitutions needed to unify the two given atoms.

If unification is not successful, the returned vector is marked as invalid. Assumes that the atoms are both of the same relation.

Definition at line 247 of file InlineRelationsTransformer.cpp.

References souffle::AstAtom::getArguments(), i, and reduceSubstitution().

247  {
248  std::vector<std::pair<AstArgument*, AstArgument*>> substitution;
249 
250  std::vector<AstArgument*> firstArgs = first->getArguments();
251  std::vector<AstArgument*> secondArgs = second->getArguments();
252 
253  // Create the initial unification equalities
254  for (size_t i = 0; i < firstArgs.size(); i++) {
255  substitution.push_back(std::make_pair(firstArgs[i], secondArgs[i]));
256  }
257 
258  // Reduce the substitutions
259  bool success = reduceSubstitution(substitution);
260  if (success) {
261  return NullableVector<std::pair<AstArgument*, AstArgument*>>(substitution);
262  } else {
263  // Failed to unify the two atoms
264  return NullableVector<std::pair<AstArgument*, AstArgument*>>();
265  }
266 }

Here is the call graph for this function:

static const std::vector<SrcLocation> souffle::usesInvalidWitness ( const std::vector< AstLiteral * > &  literals,
const std::set< std::unique_ptr< AstArgument >> &  groundedArguments 
)
static

Definition at line 727 of file AstSemanticChecker.cpp.

References souffle::AstAggregator::getBodyLiterals(), getGroundedTerms(), i, str, and visitDepthFirst().

Referenced by souffle::AstSemanticChecker::checkWitnessProblem().

728  {
729  // Node-mapper that replaces aggregators with new (unique) variables
730  struct M : public AstNodeMapper {
731  // Variables introduced to replace aggregators
732  mutable std::set<std::string> aggregatorVariables;
733 
734  const std::set<std::string>& getAggregatorVariables() {
735  return aggregatorVariables;
736  }
737 
738  std::unique_ptr<AstNode> operator()(std::unique_ptr<AstNode> node) const override {
739  static int numReplaced = 0;
740  if (dynamic_cast<AstAggregator*>(node.get())) {
741  // Replace the aggregator with a variable
742  std::stringstream newVariableName;
743  newVariableName << "+aggr_var_" << numReplaced++;
744 
745  // Keep track of which variables are bound to aggregators
746  aggregatorVariables.insert(newVariableName.str());
747 
748  return std::make_unique<AstVariable>(newVariableName.str());
749  }
750  node->apply(*this);
751  return node;
752  }
753  };
754 
755  std::vector<SrcLocation> result;
756 
757  // Create two versions of the original clause
758 
759  // Clause 1 - will remain equivalent to the original clause in terms of variable groundedness
760  auto originalClause = std::make_unique<AstClause>();
761  originalClause->setHead(std::make_unique<AstAtom>("*"));
762 
763  // Clause 2 - will have aggregators replaced with intrinsically grounded variables
764  auto aggregatorlessClause = std::make_unique<AstClause>();
765  aggregatorlessClause->setHead(std::make_unique<AstAtom>("*"));
766 
767  // Construct both clauses in the same manner to match the original clause
768  // Must keep track of the subnode in Clause 1 that each subnode in Clause 2 matches to
769  std::map<const AstArgument*, const AstArgument*> identicalSubnodeMap;
770  for (const AstLiteral* lit : literals) {
771  auto firstClone = std::unique_ptr<AstLiteral>(lit->clone());
772  auto secondClone = std::unique_ptr<AstLiteral>(lit->clone());
773 
774  // Construct the mapping between equivalent literal subnodes
775  std::vector<const AstArgument*> firstCloneArguments;
776  visitDepthFirst(*firstClone, [&](const AstArgument& arg) { firstCloneArguments.push_back(&arg); });
777 
778  std::vector<const AstArgument*> secondCloneArguments;
779  visitDepthFirst(*secondClone, [&](const AstArgument& arg) { secondCloneArguments.push_back(&arg); });
780 
781  for (size_t i = 0; i < firstCloneArguments.size(); i++) {
782  identicalSubnodeMap[secondCloneArguments[i]] = firstCloneArguments[i];
783  }
784 
785  // Actually add the literal clones to each clause
786  originalClause->addToBody(std::move(firstClone));
787  aggregatorlessClause->addToBody(std::move(secondClone));
788  }
789 
790  // Replace the aggregators in Clause 2 with variables
791  M update;
792  aggregatorlessClause->apply(update);
793 
794  // Create a dummy atom to force certain arguments to be grounded in the aggregatorlessClause
795  auto groundingAtomAggregatorless = std::make_unique<AstAtom>("grounding_atom");
796  auto groundingAtomOriginal = std::make_unique<AstAtom>("grounding_atom");
797 
798  // Force the new aggregator variables to be grounded in the aggregatorless clause
799  const std::set<std::string>& aggregatorVariables = update.getAggregatorVariables();
800  for (const std::string& str : aggregatorVariables) {
801  groundingAtomAggregatorless->addArgument(std::make_unique<AstVariable>(str));
802  }
803 
804  // Force the given grounded arguments to be grounded in both clauses
805  for (const std::unique_ptr<AstArgument>& arg : groundedArguments) {
806  groundingAtomAggregatorless->addArgument(std::unique_ptr<AstArgument>(arg->clone()));
807  groundingAtomOriginal->addArgument(std::unique_ptr<AstArgument>(arg->clone()));
808  }
809 
810  aggregatorlessClause->addToBody(std::move(groundingAtomAggregatorless));
811  originalClause->addToBody(std::move(groundingAtomOriginal));
812 
813  // Compare the grounded analysis of both generated clauses
814  // All added arguments in Clause 2 were forced to be grounded, so if an ungrounded argument
815  // appears in Clause 2, it must also appear in Clause 1. Consequently, have two cases:
816  // - The argument is also ungrounded in Clause 1 - handled by another check
817  // - The argument is grounded in Clause 1 => the argument was grounded in the
818  // first clause somewhere along the line by an aggregator-body - not allowed!
819  std::set<std::unique_ptr<AstArgument>> newlyGroundedArguments;
820  std::map<const AstArgument*, bool> originalGrounded = getGroundedTerms(*originalClause);
821  std::map<const AstArgument*, bool> aggregatorlessGrounded = getGroundedTerms(*aggregatorlessClause);
822  for (auto pair : aggregatorlessGrounded) {
823  if (!pair.second && originalGrounded[identicalSubnodeMap[pair.first]]) {
824  result.push_back(pair.first->getSrcLoc());
825  }
826 
827  // Otherwise, it can now be considered grounded
828  newlyGroundedArguments.insert(std::unique_ptr<AstArgument>(pair.first->clone()));
829  }
830 
831  // All previously grounded are still grounded
832  for (const std::unique_ptr<AstArgument>& arg : groundedArguments) {
833  newlyGroundedArguments.insert(std::unique_ptr<AstArgument>(arg->clone()));
834  }
835 
836  // Everything on this level is fine, check subaggregators of each literal
837  for (const AstLiteral* lit : literals) {
838  visitDepthFirst(*lit, [&](const AstAggregator& aggr) {
839  // Check recursively if an invalid witness is used
840  std::vector<AstLiteral*> aggrBodyLiterals = aggr.getBodyLiterals();
841  std::vector<SrcLocation> subresult = usesInvalidWitness(aggrBodyLiterals, newlyGroundedArguments);
842  for (SrcLocation argloc : subresult) {
843  result.push_back(argloc);
844  }
845  });
846  }
847 
848  return result;
849 }
souffle::getGroundedTerms
std::map< const AstArgument *, bool > getGroundedTerms(const AstClause &clause)
Analyse the given clause and computes for each contained argument whether it is a grounded value or n...

Here is the call graph for this function:

template<typename R , typename... Ps, typename... Args>
void souffle::visitDepthFirst ( const AstNode &  root,
AstVisitor< R, Ps...> &  visitor,
Args &...  args 
)

A utility function visiting all nodes within the ast rooted by the given node recursively in a depth-first pre-order fashion applying the given visitor to each encountered node.

Parameters
rootthe root of the AST to be visited
